0.title: Russia to legalise crypto as means of payment 'sooner or later'
0.article_body: Russia's Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov has said the country will be legalising cryptocurrency as a means of payment "sooner or later". "The question is, when this happens, how it will be regulated, now that the central bank and government are actively working on it," he added. Russia has plans to issue its own digital rouble.

1.title: Losing any valuable party member diminishes us: Tharoor on Hardik’s exit
1.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel’s exit from Congress, party leader Shashi Tharoor said that it’s a loss for Congress. "Losing any valuable party member diminishes us," Tharoor added. "I am very disappointed…because I've met him and been impressed by the young man as somebody who has a lot of passion, intelligence and the ability to make very effective contributions," Tharoor stated.

2.title: Doctors at Delhi's Lady Hardinge stop work over assault incident
2.article_body: Resident doctors of Delhi's Lady Hardinge Medical College announced withdrawal from all services, including emergency, from 9 am on Thursday after a patient's relative assaulted some doctors. In a letter to the hospital administration, they said some resident doctors, including one female doctor, were intimidated and assaulted on May 18. They demanded an FIR and arrest of culprits immediately.

3.title: Price of domestic LPG cylinder crosses ₹1,000-mark as rate goes up by ₹3.50
3.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was hiked by ₹3.50 on Thursday, in the second such move this month. With this, the cost of a cylinder now crosses the ₹1,000-mark, according to ANI. With the price rise, a domestic LPG cylinder will cost ₹1,003 in Delhi and Mumbai, ₹1,029 in Kolkata, and ₹1,018.5 in Chennai from today.

4.title: Sensex tanks 1,000 points, Nifty dips below 16,000-mark
4.article_body: Domestic equity market benchmarks Sensex and Nifty tumbled nearly 2% in early trade on Thursday. Sensex tanked over 1,000 points, giving up 54,000 level, while Nifty plunged over 300 points, giving up 16,000. Barring ITC, all Sensex shares opened in the red today. Meanwhile, the Indian rupee opened 11 paise lower at 77.69 against the US dollar.

5.title: India reports 2,364 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 15,419
5.article_body: India has reported 2,364 COVID-19 cases, 2,582 recoveries and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,829 COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,419, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,303.

6.title: ED books Raj Kundra for money laundering in porn videos case
6.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a money laundering case against actress Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra in connection with the production and circulation of pornography films. Kundra was arrested by Mumbai Police in 2021 for allegedly running a porn racket with operations outside India as well. ED will probe into the financial transaction pertaining to the case.

7.title: Lot depends on how it unfolds in few months: Tharoor on 'Chintan Shivir'
7.article_body: Speaking about Congress’ 'Chintan Shivir', party leader Shashi Tharoor said it’s the beginning of an important process but a lot depends on how it unfolds over the next few months. "I think if people within the party feel there is a change, we'll also be able to see it in a renewed burst of energy in the party," Tharoor added.

8.title: 25-year-old man poses as cable operator, robs houses in Pune; held
8.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for posing as personnel of an internet or cable service provider and robbing residential societies in Pune. The suspect, who is from Aurangabad, used to travel to Pune just for the robberies and targeted flats after thoroughly conducting a recce of the area, police said. Several stolen laptops and gold ornaments were recovered from him.

9.title: We keep naughty women at home: Taliban on women afraid to leave homes under its rule
9.article_body: When asked about women who say they are afraid to go out of their homes under Taliban rule, Afghanistan's acting interior minister and Taliban's co-deputy leader Sirajuddin Haqqani said, "We keep naughty women at home." "It was a joke referring to those naughty women who are controlled by some other sides to bring the current government into question," he added.

10.title: Action to be taken if unnecessary loudspeakers are installed: UP CM
10.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said action will be taken against the officials if complaints are received of "unnecessary" loudspeakers being installed and played loudly anywhere in the state. "The noise of loudspeakers should be within the premises where they are installed. We have set this example with amity. In the future also, such a situation should prevail," CM Yogi added.

11.title: Villagers in Himachal's Spiti oppose survey for gypsum mining
11.article_body: Villagers of Gue, located in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti, opposed survey of gypsum in the area fearing that government will lease out the sites to private companies. Gypsum is a mineral used in manufacturing fertilisers and cement, besides cosmetic products. As per the villagers, mining will have an adverse impact on the ecology as well as their culture.

12.title: Class 12 student attacked outside school in Delhi's Sultanpuri
12.article_body: A class 12 student of a government school was attacked with belts and knives outside his school in outer Delhi's Sultanpuri on Wednesday afternoon. The victim was walking out of the school after his examination when three-four boys attacked him, police said. The victim suffered a deep cut over his head and a stab wound on his thigh, police added.

13.title: Delhi govt likely to flag off 100 electric buses next week: Report
13.article_body: The Delhi government will likely flag off nearly 100 electric buses next week, media reports cited officials as saying. The government has received a batch of over 100 electric buses. While the ones planned to be flagged off next week are fully integrated, the remaining buses are still being integrated. There are two e-bus depots to house these buses.

14.title: Over 300 buses stay off-road in Mumbai as BEST staff go on strike
14.article_body: Over 300 mini buses remained off roads in Mumbai on Wednesday as the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) staff went on a flash strike for the second consecutive day. The strike was called by the BEST staff over non-payment of salaries and provident fund. The bus operations at Bandra, Vikhroli and Kurla depots were badly affected, BEST officials said.

15.title: Wheat shouldn't go the way of COVID-19 vaccines: India calls out West on exports at UN
15.article_body: Calling out the West, India said that wheat should not go the way of the COVID-19 vaccines as it voiced concern over hoarding and discrimination amid the "unjustified increase" in food prices at the UN. "It is necessary for all of us to adequately appreciate the importance of equity, affordability and accessibility when it comes to food grains," India said.

16.title: US reports its 1st case of monkeypox this year
16.article_body: The US on Wednesday confirmed a case of monkeypox in a man who had recently travelled to Canada. It is the first monkeypox case reported in the country this year. "The case poses no risk to the public, and the individual is hospitalised and in good condition," the Massachusetts Department of Health said in a statement.

17.title: 3 killed as truck runs over sleeping migrant labourers in Haryana's Jhajjar
17.article_body: At least three migrant labourers died and 11 others were severely injured after a truck ran over them on Kundli-Manesar-Palwal Expressway in Haryana's Jhajjar district on Thursday morning. The migrant labourers were sleeping by the roadside near a toll plaza when the truck lost control and ran over them. Ten of the injured have been taken to Rohtak's PGIMS.

18.title: Kashmiri Pandits will not be posted in vulnerable areas: Official
18.article_body: Kashmir Divisional Commissioner Pandurang K Pole on Wednesday said he has directed all heads of the government departments to ensure that Kashmiri Pandit employees are not posted in vulnerable areas. He said they should be assigned duties in towns or district headquarters. This comes days after Rahul Bhat, an employee belonging to the community, was killed in Budgam.

19.title: Death toll due to Assam floods rises to 9, over 6 lakh affected in 27 districts
19.article_body: At least nine people have lost their lives so far due to the floods in Assam, the state Disaster Management Authority said. More than 6.62 lakh people in 27 districts of Assam have been affected by the floods and landslides, it added. Around 48,000 people have taken shelter in 135 relief camps in different districts of the state.

20.title: None of the star kids I've worked with made me feel like an outsider: Tara
20.article_body: When asked how she feels working with star kids, actress Tara Sutaria said, "Most of my films are with star kids from earlier generation actors only. It's not right to keep tagging them as star kids." "I feel doing so is really very unfair. None of these actors I've worked with ever made me feel like an outsider," she added.

21.title: Inter-state drug cartel busted in Delhi, heroin worth ₹20 cr seized
21.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell recently busted an inter-state drug cartel by arresting an active member of the syndicate. Acting on a tip-off, the accused, identified as Rajesh Gupta, was arrested from Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg when he was on his way to supply the consignment to different parts of Delhi. Police also seized heroin worth ₹20 crore from him.

22.title: Gautam Gambhir's angry celebration after LSG's 2-run win over KKR goes viral
22.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir's angry celebration after his team's two-run victory against KKR has gone viral. Gambhir was seen banging the table after Rinku Singh's wicket on the second-last ball of the last over. After LSG clinched the win by dismissing Umesh Yadav on the last ball, Gambhir was seen screaming and hugging his colleagues in an animated manner.

23.title: We have no money to buy petrol, do not wait in queues at pumps: Sri Lanka to citizens
23.article_body: Sri Lanka currently has no money to pay for petrol shipments, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera told parliament as he appealed to people to stop queuing at fuel pumps. A petrol shipment has been at Colombo port since March 28 but the government has been unable to pay, he added. "We are working to find funds," he further said.

24.title: Tesla cut from S&P 500 ESG Index, Musk says 'ESG is a scam'
24.article_body: The S&P 500 removed Tesla from its ESG Index as part of an annual update citing issues including claims of racial discrimination and poor working conditions at Tesla. Responding to the exclusion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "ESG is a scam. It has been weaponised by phoney social justice warriors." "S&P Global Ratings has lost their integrity," he added.

25.title: Class 12 student stabs girlfriend's classmate for talking to her near Hyd
25.article_body: A class 12 student allegedly stabbed his girlfriend's classmate for talking to her near Hyderabad in Ranga Reddy's Rajendranagar Mandal in Telangana, police said. "After the accused came to know that his girlfriend is talking to her classmate, he called the victim...stabbed him," police added. The victim and the girl were classmates, Banjara Hills Inspector Nageshwar Rao said.

26.title: I can no longer support Democrats, will vote Republican: Elon Musk
26.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that while he voted for Democrats in the past, he will now vote for Republicans. "In the past I voted Democrat, because they were (mostly) the kindness party. But they have become the party of division & hate, so I can no longer support them and will vote Republican," he tweeted.

27.title: Bengaluru reports 112 of Karnataka's 122 new COVID-19 cases
27.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday registered 122 new COVID-19 cases and of these, 112 cases were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 150 recoveries and one coronavirus-related death during the same period. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,684 with a positivity rate of 0.93%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

28.title: Headmistress arrested for carrying beef to school in Assam
28.article_body: A government school headmistress was booked and arrested for allegedly carrying beef to school for lunch in Assam's Goalpara district. "The school management committee said that she had brought beef to school for lunch and was serving it to some members of the staff, which created a sense of discomfort among them," said a police officer.

29.title: Elon Musk loses $12 billion in a day after he tweets on politics, criticises ESG
29.article_body: Elon Musk lost $12 billion in a day after he took to Twitter to announce his political switch from Democrat to Republican and criticised Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG). Musk remains the world's richest person, with a fortune of around $210 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk called Democrats the party of division and hate.

30.title: 52-year-old motor workshop owner shot dead in Delhi's Daryaganj
30.article_body: A 52-year-old motor workshop owner was shot dead in Delhi's Daryaganj by bike-borne assailants on Tuesday night, police said. "The injured had received two gunshots and was rushed to Lok Nayak Hospital where he was declared dead," police added. The victim had gone to urinate before closing the shop and was coming back when the assailants shot him.

31.title: Hyderabad airport wins green award for 5th consecutive year
31.article_body: The Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad has won a silver award for efficient carbon management in the Airports Council International's Green Airports Recognition programme. This is for the fifth consecutive time that the airport has won the award. It was announced in the 15-50 million passengers per annum category in the Asia-Pacific region.

32.title: Thane woman abandons her baby, says 'wanted to start afresh'
32.article_body: A Thane-based woman was arrested for abandoning her 15-day-old baby near a dustbin at Mumbai's Marine Drive, police said. During interrogation, the woman said she was forcefully married to a man twice her age and had run away from his house. She allegedly dumped the baby as she "wanted to start afresh and settle down with someone of her age".

33.title: LSG eliminate KKR from IPL 2022 playoffs race with 2-run win, become 2nd team to advance
33.article_body: LSG defeated KKR by two runs in their final league match of IPL 2022 to become the second team after GT to qualify for the playoffs. With the defeat, KKR have been eliminated from the playoffs race. LSG put up a total of 210/0, with Quinton De Kock scoring 140*(70). KKR were restricted to 208/8 in their 20 overs.

34.title: EU chief proposes up to €9 billion in more aid to Ukraine
34.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed extra aid to Ukraine of up to €9 billion to help the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion. The money would be offered to Ukraine in the form of loans, according to a report. It's time to think about rebuilding Ukraine whenever the war ends, the EU chief said.

35.title: Mahesh Babu trolled over pan masala brand's ad after saying 'Bollywood can't afford me'
35.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu has been trolled for featuring in a pan masala brand's advertisement from last year alongside Tiger Shroff. This comes after his comments wherein he said "Bollywood can't afford me". "It's funny how #MaheshBabu said that #Bollywood can't afford him. But a pan masala brand can," a person tweeted while another Twitter user called it "double standards".

36.title: Plaque of Aurangzeb must be removed from all areas: Agra Mayor
36.article_body: Agra Mayor Naveen Jain said if there is a plaque of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb or if a road is named after him, it must be removed. "Aurangzeb was a cruel ruler who destroyed Hindu temples and compelled people of the Hindu community to convert to Islam," he said. His comment came after controversy over Akbaruddin Owaisi's visit to Aurangzeb's tomb.

37.title: Greece to end mandatory face mask-wearing in planes & indoor areas
37.article_body: Greece's Health Minister Thanos Plevris on Wednesday said that the country would end the mandatory wearing of face masks in airplanes and indoor public venues from June 1. Plevris, however, added that wearing of masks will remain mandatory in hospitals, nursing homes and urban transport like buses and metro. Greece reported more than 4,000 cases of coronavirus on Wednesday.

38.title: MVA govt has 'murdered' OBC's political reservation: Fadnavis
38.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis criticised the Maha Vikas Aghadi government, saying it has "murdered" the OBC's political reservation in local body polls in Maharashtra. "If Maharashtra had done the 'Triple Test', then the reservation of OBC would have been applicable here too," Fadnavis said. This comes after Supreme Court allowed OBC reservation for local body elections in Madhya Pradesh.

39.title: Politics of dishonesty, betrayal: Cong leader on Hardik's exit
39.article_body: Gujarat AICC in-charge Raghu Sharma criticised Hardik Patel over his resignation from the Congress, calling it "politics of dishonesty, betrayal". Alleging that Patel was in touch with the BJP for the last six months, he said, "He was bad-mouthing BJP in UP, Uttarakhand and Punjab. What happened overnight?" Sharma also claimed that Patel's resignation letter was not drafted by him.

40.title: Minister Ajay Mishra's nephew dies as tree branch falls on him in Lakhimpur
40.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Mishra's 41-year-old nephew Achin Mishra alias Sonu died after a branch of a tree fell on him while he was riding a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday, police said. Some people took him to a hospital, where he was declared dead. The deceased is the son of Ajay Mishra's elder brother.

41.title: Mahesh's 'B'wood can't afford me' remark was innocent statement: Ameesha
41.article_body: Actress Ameesha Patel has reacted to Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' statement and called it an "innocent statement". "I don't think he meant any harm and it should not be blown out of proportion," she added. "He is very dignified and a lovely person. Mahesh Babu can do no wrong," she concluded. Ameesha and Mahesh had featured in 'Naani'.

42.title: KCR felicitates 110-yr-old environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka
42.article_body: A 110-year-old environmentalist, Saalumarada Thimmakka, was felicitated by Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao in Hyderabad, when Thimmakka paid a courtesy visit to him at Pragati Bhavan. "Chief Minister Rao is working very hard for the development of Telangana," Thimmakka said. She also expressed happiness over development in the spheres of agriculture and forestry in Telangana.

43.title: Target's shares crash 26%, on track for their worst day since 1987
43.article_body: The shares of American department store chain Target crashed 26% on Wednesday and were on track to log their worst day since the 1987's 'Black Monday' stock market crash. Target's shares slumped after it reported a 52% drop in profit for Q1 2022. Target also warned of a bigger margin hit this year due to rising fuel and freight costs.

44.title: This is a man who tried to kill me, he's also my husband: Amber on Depp
44.article_body: Amber Heard, while being cross-examined by Johnny Depp's lawyer, was asked if she was scared of him. To this, Amber replied, "This is a man who tried to kill me...it's scary. He's also my husband." While being questioned about the couple's fight in Australia in March 2015, Amber denied assaulting Depp in the country, adding, "I didn't assault Johnny ever."

45.title: World's oldest living man confirmed as 112-year-old from Venezuela, pics released
45.article_body: Juan Vicente Pérez, from Venezuela, has been officially confirmed as the oldest person living (male) at 112 years and 253 days, as of February 4, 2022. He has 11 children, 41 grandchildren, 18 great-grandchildren and 12 great-great-grandchildren. Juan is just days away from his 113th birthday, revealed a post by Guinness World Records.

46.title: Man pleads guilty to killing 5 people in Norway bow-and-arrow attacks
46.article_body: A man on Wednesday pleaded guilty to stabbing five people to death and attempting to kill 11 others with bow and arrow in Norway's Kongsberg in October last year. The 38-year-old attacker, Espen Andersen Braathen, suffered from mental illness at time of attacks and should be sentenced to psychiatric care, prosecutors said. Proceedings in the trial will continue till June.

47.title: Wasn't reacting as producer: Sarah on Chris' alleged sexual misconduct
47.article_body: 'Sex and the City' actress Sarah Jessica Parker revealed she hasn't spoken to co-star Chris Noth since his sexual assault allegations. Asking about her reaction as a producer, she said, "Don't...know if I'm ready to talk about it, but...I wasn't reacting as a producer." "We're deeply saddened to hear the allegations," Sarah and her co-stars had said in a statement.

48.title: Tencent's profit halves in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004
48.article_body: China's Tencent said its profit had halved YoY and it recorded no revenue growth in Q1 2022, its worst performance since 2004. Tencent's revenue in Q1 2022 was ¥135.5 billion (₹1,55,959 crore) as compared with ¥135.3 billion (₹1,55,728 crore) in Q1 2021. This comes after China launched a regulatory crackdown last year to reign in influence of large internet firms.

49.title: AAP's CM face in U'khand Assembly polls Ajay Kothiyal quits party
49.article_body: Colonel Ajay Kothiyal (Retired), AAP's CM face in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections that were held in February this year, resigned from the party on Wednesday. He had contested polls from the Gangotri Assembly constituency and joined AAP on April 19 last year. Kothiyal, who shared his resignation letter on Twitter, did not provide any reason for quitting the party.

50.title: Surat Police seize 30 kg of marijuana worth ₹3 lakh, 3 arrested
50.article_body: The Surat Police said that they arrested three youths from Odisha and seized marijuana worth ₹3 lakh from them. The Special Operation Group (SOG) intercepted three youths whose movements were suspicious and upon checking, over 30.35 kg marijuana was found in their luggage. Police said they are trying to find out who they were supposed to deliver the contraband to.

51.title: Head constable arrested for taking bribe of ₹20,000 in MP's Bhind
51.article_body: A head constable posted in Malanpur of Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district was arrested by the Lokayukta police for accepting a bribe of ₹20,000. The head constable, identified as Manish Pachauri, reportedly demanded the bribe from the victim and threatened to implicate him in a false case. After the incident, the victim approached the Lokayukta police and complained.

52.title: Lucknow University prof assaulted after remark on Kashi Vishwanath temple
52.article_body: Lucknow University's Associate Professor RV Chandan was allegedly assaulted by a student on the campus on Wednesday, days after he made "objectionable" comments on Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath temple. "Karthik Pandey, a student leader, came to me, started hurling abuses and casteist slurs at me and hit me," Chandan said. Pandey was overpowered by guards and handed over to the police.

53.title: ABVP holds protest over SSC recruitment scam in Kolkata
53.article_body: Members of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) held a protest in Kolkata against the alleged irregularities in the SSC recruitment process and the deteriorating law and order situation in the state. The police used water cannons and barricades to stop the protesters. ABVP further demanded transparency with regards to the SSC recruitment process.

54.title: LSG record the highest opening partnership in IPL history
54.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Wednesday recorded the highest-ever opening partnership in IPL history. Quinton De Kock and KL Rahul shared an unbeaten 210-run stand against KKR to set the record. The previous record was held by Jonny Bairstow and David Warner, who shared a 185-run opening stand for SRH against RCB on March 31, 2019.

55.title: Telangana's 'Tree Man' injured in accident on way to water plants
55.article_body: The 'Tree Man' of Telangana, Daripalli Ramaiah, received injuries to his right leg and head after falling on road from his bicycle on his way to water plants on Wednesday. The 85-year-old Padma Shri awardee is in ICU and his condition is stable, doctors said. He is said to have planted over one crore trees.

56.title: ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of Morbi wall collapse victims: CM
56.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel announced a compensation of ₹4 lakh to the families of the 12 people who died after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in Gujarat's Morbi. "My condolences to the bereaved families," Patel tweeted. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expressed grief at the loss of lives in the mishap and called the tragedy "heart-rending".

57.title: Cannes-like festival should happen in India: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur
57.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur said a Cannes-like film festival should be held in India. "The next Cannes is in India because if it's not, then I don't know where Cannes will go. We're the land of stories. The west is plateauing...the east is rising. We're the east, we've to step forward," he stated. "This is a moment of confidence," he added.

58.title: Ukraine's Prez gets standing ovation after his speech at Cannes
58.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday received a standing ovation after he virtually addressed the opening ceremony of the Cannes Film Festival. In his address, Zelenskyy quoted Charlie Chaplin's film 'The Great Dictator', saying, "[Hate] of men will pass and dictators die and...power they took from...people will return to...people." His remarks came amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

59.title: Finland & Sweden to buy weapons together as they apply to join NATO
59.article_body: Finland and Sweden will procure portable firearms and anti-tank weapons together, Finland's defence ministry said on Wednesday. The purchase will include assault rifles, shotguns, missiles, recoilless rifles and arms for personal protection, the ministry added. The announcement comes as both countries handed over their applications to NATO to join the military alliance earlier today.

60.title: 28% GST on casinos, online gaming in final report by Group of Ministers: Report
60.article_body: The Group of Ministers tasked to review the GST levy on casinos, racecourses and online gaming finalised its report that reportedly favours 28% tax on the three services. The final report by the panel led by Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma will be handed over to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in a day or two. Currently, these services attract 18% GST.

61.title: Quinton De Kock smashes 10 sixes in an innings, records highest score of IPL 2022
61.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) opener Quinton De Kock on Wednesday recorded the highest individual score of IPL 2022 by scoring 140*(70) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). De Kock smashed 10 sixes and 10 fours in his innings. It is also the third-highest individual score in IPL history after Chris Gayle's 175* and Brendon McCullum's 158*.

62.title: Not aware if Shailesh Lodha wants to quit 'Taarak Mehta...': Producer
62.article_body: Producer Asit Modi, in an interview, said that he is not aware that Shailesh Lodha wants to quit 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "I've not been informed...If there is any development, I'll surely speak about it," he said. This comes after reports had stated that Shailesh, who plays Taarak, was unhappy with his contract and will be quitting the show.

63.title: List of cities with highest maximum temperature today released
63.article_body: The IMD has released the name of cities that reported more than 43°C on Wednesday. UP's Banda with 46.2°C had the highest maximum temperature, followed by Jhansi's 45.4°C. UP's Prayagraj and Rajasthan's Pilani recorded 45.2°C as maximum temperature and Rajasthan's Churu and MP's Nowgong had 45°C as maximum temperature. Eleven cities recorded maximum temperature between 44°C and 45°C.

64.title: Former soldier, who lost both legs in Afghanistan, climbs 3,560-ft mountain in UK
64.article_body: A former soldier, who lost both his legs while fighting in Afghanistan in 2011, has climbed the highest mountain in Wales. Double amputee Liam King scaled Mount Snowdon, which is 3,560-feet-tall. He made it to the summit in seven hours with fellow veteran Luke Read. "I wanted to prove to myself that I can do it," said Liam.

65.title: Video shows Anil Kapoor dancing in Rajasthan while Jeremy Renner claps
65.article_body: A video of Anil Kapoor dancing in front of schoolchildren in Alwar, Rajasthan has gone viral on social media. 'Avengers' actor Jeremy Renner can be seen clapping to Anil's dance in the video. This comes after pictures of Anil and Jeremy shooting in Rajasthan began circulating on social media. Anil is shooting with Jeremy for series 'Rennervations'.

66.title: Bike taxi driver arrested for following, eve-teasing 24-yr-old woman racer in TN
66.article_body: Police has arrested a 34-year-old bike taxi driver in Chennai for allegedly following and eve-teasing 24-year-old professional motorcycle racer and two-time national champion Nivetha Jessica. She said that Hasan had followed her on his bike for around 10 minutes on May 11. Nivetha added that when she yelled at him, he rode away, shouting, "I will do this again."

67.title: Tribal students protest, demand more colleges in MP's Jabalpur
67.article_body: Tribal students of Bargi constituency of Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district staged a protest, demanding colleges to be built in Bargi and Chargwan. The students along with Congress MLA Sanjay Yadav reached the commissioner's office and submitted a written memorandum regarding the issue. Many students discontinued their studies after class 12 due to lack of colleges, a student said.

68.title: Russia expels 85 diplomats from European nations in tit-for-tat move
68.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry on Wednesday announced the expulsion of 85 embassy staff from France, Spain and Italy in response to similar moves by these countries. These three countries are among European nations that have reportedly expelled over 200 Russian diplomats since the country began invading Ukraine in February. Meanwhile, Italian PM Mario Draghi called Russia's announcement a "hostile act".

69.title: Google's Russian subsidiary to file for bankruptcy after account seizure
69.article_body: Google's Russian subsidiary plans to file for bankruptcy after its bank account was seized by authorities, a Google spokesperson said on Wednesday. "Russian authorities' seizure of Google Russia's bank account has made it untenable for our Russia office to function," the spokesperson said. This is the first time that Google said its bank account as a whole has been seized.

70.title: India's richest man enters the healthcare sector with 'Adani Health Ventures'
70.article_body: India's richest man Gautam Adani has entered the healthcare sector with Adani Enterprises' wholly-owned subsidiary 'Adani Health Ventures Limited' (AHVL). "The subsidiary was incorporated on May 17, 2022, to carry on the business of healthcare-related activities," a filing said. The activities include medical and diagnostic facilities, health aids and health tech-based facilities among others.

71.title: 3 Delhi civic bodies unified, to be treated as one from May 22
71.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Wednesday issued a notification for the unification of the three civic bodies of Delhi. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22. Legislation to unify the civic bodies was approved by Lok Sabha on March 30 and by Rajya Sabha on April 5.

72.title: People queue up in Colombo to get 2-time meals amid economic crisis
72.article_body: Several Sri Lankan citizens, including daily wage labourers, have queued up at Galle Face in Colombo to receive two-time meals from a food trust. "[People] are coming from far away by buses, taxis and train(s)...We provide food to all without...discrimination," a social worker said. Sri Lanka is reeling under economic crisis which has triggered a shortage of essentials, including food.

73.title: 21-year-old Russian soldier pleads guilty to killing 62-year-old civilian in Ukraine
73.article_body: A Russian soldier accused of war crimes in Ukraine pleaded guilty on Wednesday to killing a 62-year-old unarmed civilian. Vadim Shishimarin, a 21-year-old Russian tank commander, entered his plea in a Kyiv district court hearing its first war crimes trial since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. If convicted, he faces up to life imprisonment.

74.title: AIMIM leader held over derogatory post on 'Shivling' inside Gyanvapi Mosque
74.article_body: Gujarat AIMIM leader Danish Qureshi was arrested by the Ahmedabad Police on Wednesday for making derogatory remarks on Twitter on the 'Shivling' found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque complex. Qureshi was arrested after Hindu organisations made a representation before the police. "We carried out a technical analysis of the Twitter handle and arrested Qureshi," said ACP (Crime Branch) JM Yadav.

75.title: Can we call ourselves democracy: DK Shivakumar on Panchayat polls
75.article_body: KPCC president DK Shivakumar held the Karnataka government responsible for the "non-conduct of Panchayat elections". He also expressed concerns regarding Karnataka State Election Commission's urgent petition in the High Court. "When the Election Commission itself says the government has taken away its powers, can we call ourselves a democracy?" he questioned.

76.title: Mumbai Naval officer asked to fill KYC details, cheated of ₹1 lakh
76.article_body: The Mumbai police have registered a case against an unidentified person after a senior Naval officer was cheated of ₹1 lakh. The complaint said the officer received a text message with a link asking him to complete his KYC formalities. As the officer entered his bank details, the accused transferred ₹1 lakh to his own account, a police officer said.

77.title: 13-year-old girl raped by relative in Pune, case registered
77.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her relative in Pune's Lonikand. Reports say that the accused, a distant relative of the victim, ran away from the scene after he committed the crime. The accused raped the minor when she was alone at home, reports stated. The police have registered a case under relevant sections of IPC and POCSO Act.

78.title: Cleanliness drive launched around Navi Mumbai's Ballaleshwar Lake
78.article_body: In a joint effort by NGO Robin Hood Army and the Rotaract club of Panvel Industrial Town, a cleanliness drive was launched around Ballaleshwar Lake, which is Panvel's oldest lake. Volunteers said that the waste mostly constituted of single-use plastic. The aim is to encourage people to reduce, reuse and recycle non-biodegradable substances, a volunteer said.

79.title: Don't line up for petrol, we can't buy it: Sri Lankan govt to citizens
79.article_body: Sri Lankan government on Wednesday urged citizens to not line up to buy petrol as the country doesn't have foreign exchange to pay for it. Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera told parliament that payment for a previous shipment of petrol worth $53 million is also pending. Earlier, Sri Lankan PM had said that the country was left with limited petrol stocks.

80.title: Jury shown knife actress Amber Heard gave actor Johnny Depp in 2012
80.article_body: The jury was shown a knife which was gifted by actress Amber Heard to actor Johnny Depp in 2012. Amber had alleged that Depp began abusing her in 2011 before a break in 2012. Depp's lawyer asked Amber, "That's the knife...you gave to the man who was abusing you?" To this, Amber replied, "I wasn't afraid of him stabbing me."

81.title: Rahul preferred choice of party workers to be Cong chief: Tharoor
81.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said that there remains no doubt that his party colleague Rahul Gandhi would be the preferred choice of an overwhelming majority of party workers to be Congress chief. However, he added that Rahul has not indicated whether he wants the job. His comments come days after the Congress organised a three-day 'Chintan Shivir' in Rajasthan.

82.title: Pak woman lost during Partition meets Indian brothers after 75 yrs at Kartarpur
82.article_body: A woman who was separated from her family during Partition met her brothers from India at Kartarpur in Pakistan's Punjab province after 75 years. Mumtaz Bibi was born in a Sikh family and was raised by a Muslim couple in Pakistan. She got to know about her real family two years ago and got connected with them through social media.

83.title: Rajasthan Congress MLA Ganesh Ghogra resigns from his seat, says 'was being ignored'
83.article_body: Congress MLA from Rajasthan's Dungarpur, Ganesh Ghogra, resigned from his seat on Wednesday. He is also the president of the state Youth Congress. Ghogra said he was being ignored despite being an MLA of the ruling party in the state. He added that the administration doesn't listen when he brings up people's concerns.

84.title: Bengaluru-based Grammy winner Ricky Kej repeats his Grammy outfit at Cannes
84.article_body: US-born Indian music composer Ricky Kej, who has lived in Bengaluru since he was eight, repeated his Grammy Awards outfit at the Cannes Film Festival. Two-time Grammy award-winner, Kej, took to Instagram to share his pictures from both the events and wrote, "Fashion can be trendy twice." Citing pollution from the fashion industry, he added, "Fast fashion isn't always fashionable."

85.title: ITC reports 11.7% YoY rise in net profit to ₹4,196 crore in Q4
85.article_body: FMCG giant ITC Limited on Wednesday reported an 11.7% YoY rise in consolidated net profit at ₹4,196 crore in Q4 FY22, against ₹3,755 crore reported in Q4 FY21. Consolidated revenue for Q4 FY22 came in at ₹17,754 crore, a 15.3% YoY rise from ₹15,404 crore. ITC's consolidated PAT and revenue for FY22 jumped to ₹15,243 crore and ₹65,205 crore respectively.

86.title: Landmines explode along LoC due to forest fire in J&K
86.article_body: A forest fire has triggered several landmine explosions along the LoC in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, officials said on Wednesday. The landmines were part of the anti-infiltration obstacle system. "The forest fire has been raging for the past three days...This morning it started in Daramshal block and spread fast due to powerful winds," Forester Kanar Hussain Shah said.

87.title: Heroism is working again: Bhushan Kumar on success of South films
87.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about the recent success of South films, said, "They're pure entertainers. They have music, action, heroism, the mother element, the way it used to be in our 90s films." "They are presenting it at a high scale...it's working," he stated while adding that people won't watch scaled-down mass entertainers. "Heroism is working again," he concluded.

88.title: Ukraine 'lacks will' to continue peace talks: Russia
88.article_body: Russia has accused Ukraine of not wanting to continue talks to end hostilities amid the ongoing conflict between the two nations. "Talks are indeed not moving forward and we note...complete lack of will of Ukrainian negotiators to continue this process," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. This comes after Kyiv's negotiator Mykhailo Podolyak said that talks with Moscow were "on hold".

89.title: TN CM hails Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release from jail
89.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin reacted to release of Perarivalan, one of the convicts in ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, praising verdict for serving as an example of India's federalism. "Congratulations...to Perarivalan for fully breathing...the air of liberation [after over] 30 years of [jail]," he tweeted. Stalin also praised Perarivalan's mother for her perseverance during his imprisonment.

90.title: Battery car services to Vaishno Devi shrine suspended for the day
90.article_body: The battery car services to the Vaishno Devi shrine were suspended on the new track on Wednesday due to a forest fire in the Trikuta hills. However, the pilgrimage continued through the traditional track. The fire broke out near the Sanji Chhat helipad in the forest area of Trikuta hills on late Sunday evening.

91.title: World's tallest building Burj Khalifa vanishes in a layer of dust amid sandstorm
91.article_body: The world's tallest building Burj Khalifa disappeared behind a grey layer of dust today as sandstorms that have swept the Middle East hit the United Arab Emirates, prompting weather and traffic warnings. Capital city Abu Dhabi's air quality index (AQI) soared into the "hazardous" zone overnight. Authorities issued a nationwide warning urging residents to remain vigilant.

92.title: Nikhat reaches final at Women's World Boxing Championships; Manisha, Parveen win bronze
92.article_body: Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen defeated Brazil's Caroline De Almeida to enter the 52-kg category final at the Women's World Boxing Championships. Meanwhile, Manisha Moun bagged a bronze medal after losing in the semi-final against Tokyo Olympics bronze medallist Irma Testa. In the 63-kg category, Parveen Hooda bagged a bronze after losing to European Championships bronze medallist Amy Broadhurst.

93.title: LSG to bat first against KKR in their last league stage match, make 3 changes
93.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bat first against KKR in their last league stage clash in IPL 2022 on Wednesday. LSG have made three changes to their playing XI, with Manan Vohra, Evin Lewis and Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Ayush Badoni, Dushmantha Chameera and Krunal Pandya. KKR have replaced Ajinkya Rahane with Abhijeet Tomar.

94.title: India looks a lot like Sri Lanka: Rahul on graphs comparing economies
94.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused the Centre of failing to curb inflation and employment crisis in the country and stated that "India looks a lot like Sri Lanka". Gandhi took to Twitter to share graphs comparing both countries' statistics on unemployment, petrol prices and communal violence. Notably, Sri Lanka is undergoing its worst economic crisis since its independence.

95.title: It deeply saddens us: Congress on Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict's release
95.article_body: After the Supreme Court ordered release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "The decision...deeply saddens us." "If those guilty of terrorism and assassination of a PM are going to be released like this, then who'll uphold the majesty and the integrity of law in this country," he asked.

96.title: Punjab govt agrees to farmers' demand on advancing paddy sowing
96.article_body: The Punjab government on Wednesday accepted the demands raised by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) by agreeing to advance the paddy transplantation in three phases beginning June 7. The earlier schedule of paddy transplantation consisted of four phases starting June 18. The government also agreed to buy moong (green grams) at MSP, for which the mandis have been identified.

97.title: I am leaving Twitter, it's not because of Elon: Twitter VP of Product Management
97.article_body: Ilya Brown, one of Twitter's latest three senior executives to leave Twitter, tweeted, "Yes, I'm leaving Twitter. No, it is not because of Elon or uncertainty inside the company." Ilya Brown, Twitter's Vice President of Product Management, said, "It has been an amazing six years and I've loved every second of it." Ilya added, "I will forever love this place."

98.title: Open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting Oscars 2023: ABC President
98.article_body: ABC President of Entertainment Craig Erwich has said that they are open to the idea of Chris Rock hosting the Academy Awards in 2023. This comes after actor Will Smith slapped Chris Rock during the 2022 event. "There was a...controversy, which overshadowed a lot of...positive things about the show, but I was really happy with the program," Craig said.

99.title: Pune's new art centre 'Zapurza' to be inaugurated on May 19
99.article_body: An all-inclusive art point named 'Zapurza' is set to be inaugurated in Pune on Thursday. The centre, which was reportedly under construction for four years, will house as many as eight galleries, an amphitheatre, an auditorium and will display various artworks from locations including Mumbai and Kolhapur. Additionally, there will be two separate galleries dedicated to jewellery and textiles.

100.title: Hyd Police arrests university VC in fake educational certificates scam
100.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested the vice-chancellor of Bhopal's Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan University in connection with a fake educational certificates scam. A former vice-chancellor has also been arrested. In February, four cases were registered against a few educational consultants and the management of the university for allegedly providing educational certificates in return for money.

101.title: Railway employee crushed to death by train in Gr Noida: Police
101.article_body: A 33-year-old railway employee died on duty after being run over by a train in Greater Noida on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased, identified as Sunil Kumar Verma, was working on the rail track segment near Dadri when he got hit by the train, police added. Verma was reportedly working with the railway as technician grade one (signal).

102.title: I've to breathe: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict on release from jail after 31 yrs
102.article_body: AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, was released from jail after 31 years on the order of the Supreme Court today. As he stepped out, Perarivalan told reporters, "I have just come out...I've to breathe a bit. Give me some time." He further said he firmly believes "there's no need for capital punishment".

103.title: ₹25,000 aid will be given for rain-hit houses in B'luru: K'taka CM
103.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced that a compensation of ₹25,000 would be given each to those whose houses have been flooded and affected due to heavy rains in Bengaluru. Furthermore, Bommai also announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh each for the families of the two labourers who died due to heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru.

104.title: I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human: Musk
104.article_body: Elon Musk said, "I have the honour of having the most-liked tweet of any living human. Thank you everyone for liking my tweet." Musk said that his tweet, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in," has over 4.8 million likes. Notably, the tweet announcing actor Chadwick Boseman's death is the most-liked ever, with over 7.1 million likes.

105.title: Protesting farmers to meet Punjab CM to discuss their demands
105.article_body: A group of protesting Punjab farmers on Wednesday said they'll meet CM Bhagwant Mann to discuss their demands. "[Deputy Commissioner] and SSP came to take us (for the meeting) and...message (for the meeting) is from CM sahab," said farmer leader Baldev Singh Sirsa. This comes after farmers protested near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday after being stopped from entering Chandigarh.

106.title: Tata Consumer Products in talks to acquire as many as 5 brands
106.article_body: Tata Consumer Products (TCP), the food and beverage arm of Tata Group, is in talks to acquire as many as five consumer brands. A "significant amount" of the Mumbai-based firm's future growth will come from inorganic expansion, TCP CEO Sunil D'Souza said. "We're reaching out to potential targets to have a chat to see if there is interest," D'Souza added.

107.title: BJP creating communal issues to divert attention from price hike: Mamata
107.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged, "The Narendra Modi government is engineering communal disturbances to divert the attention of the common people." She accused the Centre of looting the common people by hiking the prices of domestic gas, petrol and diesel. Banerjee was addressing a party programme at Midnapore College ground.

108.title: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal resigns: Reports
108.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal has submitted his resignation to President Ram Nath Kovind, citing personal reasons, according to reports. He was appointed as the Delhi Lieutenant Governor in December, 2016 after Najeeb Jung had resigned from the post. He had previously served as the Union Home Secretary.

109.title: Video shows white man urinating on black student's books, laptop in SA; students protest
109.article_body: Students have launched protests at South Africa's Stellenbosch University after a video showing a white student urinating on a black student's personal belongings, including books and laptop, surfaced online. The accused, who has been identified as 25-year-old Theuns Du Toit, has been suspended. "It's a White thing, boy," Du Toit reportedly told the student after urinating on his things.

110.title: 959 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol surrendered so far: Russia
110.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said 694 Ukrainian fighters who'd been holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered over the past 24 hours. So far, 959 soldiers at the plant have handed themselves over to Russian troops, it added. Ukraine has offered to release Russian prisoners of war in exchange for Mariupol fighters.

111.title: K'taka HC quashes BBMP's demand of ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old school
111.article_body: The Karnataka High Court quashed Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) notice demanding ₹69 lakh from 150-year-old Good Shepherd Convent school and said that the demand has "no legal legs to stand". In 2014, the school made application to BBMP seeking licence to construct four additional floors and paid ₹1,61,438 as scrutiny fee but BBMP demanded ₹69 lakh as betterment charge.

112.title: I competed with myself in bettering what I did last: Jaaved on his projects
112.article_body: Speaking about his career choices, Jaaved Jaaferi said, "I wanted to be happy with what I was doing. Most of the work I did, I did connect to it but sometimes you do things as you need to do it." "I...competed with myself in bettering what I did last," he added. Jaaved further said now he wants to do better.

113.title: People within Cong have no faith in party: Owaisi on Hardik Patel's exit
113.article_body: Reacting to Hardik Patel's departure from Congress ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that those within Congress don't have any faith in party. "Congress ruled Maharashtra for 15 years but now...party has slipped to third position...Congress is nowhere to be seen in Delhi," he added. Patel resigned as working president of Congress' Gujarat unit earlier today.

114.title: No matter what size you are, people will discuss it: Sonakshi on body shaming
114.article_body: During an interview, actress Sonakshi Sinha said both she and actress Huma Qureshi have faced body and weight-shaming for years during the initial years of their careers. "It happened from the beginning of our careers in this line and it still happens. It hasn't stopped," she added. "No matter what size you are, people are always discussing it," Sonakshi said.

115.title: Rahul Tripathi should be in the mix for Team India: Ravi Shastri
115.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said SRH batter Rahul Tripathi is "not far" from receiving an India call-up. He added, "If someone gets injured, this guy can be slotted in straight away...Rahul Tripathi is a dangerous player and should be in the mix." Shastri further said, "If he's performing season after season, I'm sure the selectors will be watching."

116.title: It is good that Hardik Patel left the party: Gujarat Cong incharge
116.article_body: Gujarat Congress incharge Raghu Sharma on Wednesday said it was good that Hardik Patel left the party as Patel's personal ambitions were larger than Congress' ideology. Sharma said Hardik was insecure of losing his space in the party if Rajkot-based businessman Naresh Patel joined the party. Hardik resigned from Congress' primary membership on Wednesday.

117.title: ITBP rescues 2 trekkers, stranded for over 48 hours in U'khand
117.article_body: A team of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) rescued two trekkers, who were stranded for over 48 hours, during an expedition in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh, a senior officer said on Wednesday. Vishal Gangwar and Santosh Kumar started their trek to Khaliya Top on Sunday and got stranded near Birthi fall in Munsiyari. They are being brought to safety through land route.

118.title: Big mistake: Mackie on Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown
118.article_body: Designer Bob Mackie, speaking about Kim Kardashian wearing Marilyn Monroe's gown at Met Gala, said, "I thought it was a big mistake." "[Marilyn] was a goddess. A crazy goddess, but a goddess...it was done for her. It was designed for her. Nobody else should be seen in that dress," he added. Kim had worn Marilyn's original 1962 Jean Louis gown.

119.title: Kareena is very polite & down to earth: Chef who cooked for her in Kalimpong
119.article_body: Kareena Kapoor, who has been shooting in Kalimpong for Sujoy Ghosh's 'Devotion of Suspect X', posted stories about a bakery in the hills named Neena's Kitchen. She tagged one of the dishes as the "best meal ever" and also praised the dessert. Reacting to it, chef Neena who cooked for her said, "Kareena is very polite and down to earth."

120.title: 19-yr-old man enters 13-yr-old relative's house, rapes her in Pune; booked
120.article_body: Pune Police have booked a 19-year-old man for allegedly raping his 13-year-old relative. According to police, the accused and the victim stay in the same neighbourhood. The FIR based on the complaint filed, said that the man entered the girl's house when her family was away and took advantage of the absence of her family.

121.title: Bhagyashree breaks down at son Abhimanyu's 'Nikamma' trailer launch
121.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree got emotional at the trailer launch of her son Abhimanyu Dassani's film 'Nikamma'. She added, "He has put a lot of effort into this film. The shooting of this film...went on for two years during COVID-19." "He has done...[a] good work [and]...worked so hard...Just keep this nikamma in your heart," Bhagyashree said.

122.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi after 12 die in Guj wall collapse incident
122.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives after 12 labourers were killed when a wall of a factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat. Taking to Twitter, PM Modi said, "The tragedy in Morbi caused by a wall collapse is heart-rending." He further announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of the deceased.

123.title: Special arrangements made for animals at Tanday Deer Park amid rising heat
123.article_body: Special arrangements have been made for the animals at Tanday Rakh and Mantalai Deer Park in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur during summer. "With the prolonged dry spell and forest fires, we ensure to enrich their diet; provide watermelon, cucumber, agro-feed, green fodder and 24-hour water supply," a forest guard said. "We sprinkle water in sheds to cool them," he added.

124.title: Taliban ask female UN staffers to wear hijab, say will monitor
124.article_body: The Taliban-led government of Afghanistan has reportedly issued a statement asking female staff members of the UN Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) to wear hijab. The Ministry of Propagation of Virtue and Prevention of Vice said that its personnel will stand outside the UNAMA office to monitor if the women are wearing hijab or not.

125.title: Will retain neutral status: Austria after Sweden-Finland NATO bid
125.article_body: Austrian Foreign Minister Alexander Schallenberg said Austria would retain its neutral status even as Sweden and Finland overhauled decades-long foreign policy stances to apply for NATO membership amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Schallenberg added that Austria, which obtains 80% of its natural gas from Russia, would continue to provide humanitarian support to Ukraine rather than lethal weapons.

126.title: Matthew Mott appointed England men's white-ball team head coach
126.article_body: Former Australia Women coach Matthew Mott has been appointed the head coach of England men's white-ball cricket team. He has been appointed on a contract of four years. Under Mott, Australia Women won consecutive T20 World Cups and one 50-over World Cup, went four Ashes series undefeated and also set the world record for most consecutive ODI victories (26).

127.title: Hadn't hiked prices for Kabir Singh, it did over ₹270 cr at box office: Producer
127.article_body: 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani said that the ticket prices were not hiked for the movie. "It did over ₹270 crore at the box office. The footfalls of Kabir Singh are higher than the biggest blockbusters of 2019. I believe, if your film is good, it ends up collecting well at the box office," he added.

128.title: Deepika, others dance as Mame Khan sings at inauguration of India Pavilion at Cannes
128.article_body: Folk artist Mame Khan sang during the inauguration of India Pavilion at the 75th Cannes Film Festival. A video of his performance was shared by Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Twitter. Actresses Deepika Padukone, Urvashi Rautela, Tamannaah Bhatia and Pooja Hegde were seen dancing in the video as Khan sang.

129.title: One day, India won't have to be at Cannes, Cannes will be in India: Deepika
129.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, during the inauguration of the India Pavilion at the 75th Cannes Film Festival, said, "There will come a day, I truly believe, where India won't have to be at Cannes, [but] Cannes will be in India." She added, "We have a long way to go as a country...we have the talent, the ability...we just need that conviction."

130.title: Mushfiqur beats Tamim to become first Bangladesh batter to reach 5,000 Test runs
130.article_body: Mushfiqur Rahim has beaten Tamim Iqbal in the race to reach 5,000 Test runs, becoming the first Bangladesh batter to reach the milestone. Rahim achieved the feat during his 105-run knock in Bangladesh's first innings in first Test against Sri Lanka. He has scored 5,037 Test runs. Tamim, who scored 133 runs in the innings, has scored 4,981 Test runs.

131.title: Traffic constable breaks down after BJP MLA's relatives drag him to police station in UP
131.article_body: A video clip of a traffic police constable breaking down at a police station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao has gone viral. According to reports, some people claiming to be relatives of BJP MLA Ashutosh Shukla dragged the constable to the station after he stopped their SUV with a hooter and BJP flag. The accused allegedly threatened him with dire consequences.

132.title: Depp said, 'We're married now, I can punch Amber in face': Amber's friend
132.article_body: Amber Heard's friend iO Tillett Wright, in pre-recorded testimony played in court, recalled his conversation with Johnny Depp at the couple's wedding in February 2015 in the Bahamas. "Depp said, 'We're married now. I can punch her (Amber) in the face...nobody can do anything about it'," claimed Wright. Earlier, Amber had alleged that Depp hit her during their honeymoon.

133.title: It was runaway hit, I played 40-year-old Champu at 22: Neena on Marathi play
133.article_body: Actress Neena Kulkarni took to Instagram to share her picture from the back page of the printed classic Marathi play 'Mahasagar'. "I remember I was stoked to be on the cover! All of 22 years then, I played role of a 40-year-old Champu. It was a runaway hit...800 odd shows! And it had a super cast," she wrote.

134.title: Tesla to show sneak preview of humanoid Tesla Bot on AI Day in Aug
134.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed in a tweet that the firm will be showing a sneak preview of its humanoid Tesla Bot in August. The preview will be shown on August 19, when Tesla is holding its second AI Day. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," Musk had tweeted earlier.

135.title: I want to be known as the woman who lived her life queen-sized: Malaika Arora
135.article_body: Actress Malaika describes her childhood as 'tumultuous'. She said that her tough times also taught her some important lessons. "Those early lessons are the cornerstones of my life and professional journey. I am still fiercely independent; I value my freedom," she added. Malaika further said that she wants to be known as the woman who lived her life queen-sized.

136.title: Change of pace, length is what makes Arshdeep stand out: Ian Bishop
136.article_body: Ex-WI fast bowler Ian Bishop has said PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh's "change of pace and length" makes him stand out among the young pacers in the ongoing IPL season. "Arshdeep has good accuracy and a great feel for knowing when to bowl what type of delivery," explained Bishop. So far, Arshdeep has picked 10 wickets in 13 games.

137.title: Kolkata port to export 4,000 tonnes of wheat to B'desh amid export ban
137.article_body: Kolkata's Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port is set to export 4,000 tonnes of wheat to Bangladesh by May 13 amid the Centre's wheat export ban order. Notably, Centre relaxed its previous order on Tuesday, stating that consignments handed over to customs on or prior to May 13 would be allowed for export. India has halted wheat exports to ensure food security.

138.title: Sri Lankan police arrest 2 ruling party lawmakers over mob violence
138.article_body: Sri Lankan police have arrested two ruling party lawmakers for allegedly instigating mob violence that plunged the country into days of unrest and left nine people dead and over 200 injured last week. "There is direct evidence against the...MPs," an official said. Sanath Nishantha and Milan Jayathilake were among several politicians banned from leaving Sri Lanka over May 9 violence.

139.title: UK inflation hits 9% in April, its highest level since 1982
139.article_body: Consumer price inflation in the United Kingdom reached 9% in April 2022, its highest level since 1982. British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said countries around the world were being hit by high inflation and the jump in inflation in UK reflected the increase in regulated energy tariffs. "We cannot protect people completely from these global challenges," Sunak said.

140.title: Rupee closes at a new all-time low of 77.58 against US dollar
140.article_body: The Indian rupee closed at a new all-time low of 77.58 against the US dollar on Wednesday. The Indian rupee had closed at 77.47 against the US dollar on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the stock market slipped into the red, halting a two-day upward trend. Sensex settled at 54,209 points, while the Nifty stood at 16,240 points.

141.title: HC seeks Delhi govt's reply on making Yoga Science compulsory till Class 8
141.article_body: The Delhi High Court has sought a response from the Centre, Delhi government and NCERT on a PIL to make Health and Yoga Science compulsory for students till Class 8. The petitioner has submitted that the Right to Health and Right to Education are complementary and supplementary to each other. He said yoga is a medical and life science.

142.title: It was luck that 19th over vs MI turned out to be maiden: Bhuvneshwar
142.article_body: SRH's Bhuvneshwar Kumar, while interacting with Umran Malik, said that it was "luck" that the 19th over against MI turned out to be maiden. "I felt the yorker was the best option on that wicket to prevent run-scoring...Luckily, all deliveries landed in a good spot," he added. MI needed 19 off 12 to win when Bhuvneshwar bowled the maiden over.

143.title: Trump's social media firm may raise $50 mn before SPAC deal closes
143.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's social media venture has said it may raise up to $50 million through convertible notes before it merges with a blank-check acquisition firm, filings revealed. TMTG raised $38.2 million through issuance of convertible promissory notes, as of March 31. TMTG is set to receive $1.25 billion in funding once it merges with Digital World Acquisition.

144.title: Stones hurled at Dalit man's marriage procession over DJ music in MP
144.article_body: A Dalit man's marriage procession was allegedly attacked by few people in MP's Rajgarh district, following a dispute over DJ music being played during the celebration, which left three people injured. The procession was passing outside a mosque at around 11 pm, when some people of a community objected to DJ music being played during the celebration, the police said.

145.title: IndiGo names Pieter Elbers as CEO, Ronojoy Dutta to retire
145.article_body: IndiGo on Wednesday announced the appointment of Pieter Elbers as the airline's CEO, subject to regulatory approvals. The 52-year-old will join IndiGo on or before October 1, 2022, and will succeed 71-year-old Ronojoy Dutta, who has decided to retire on September 30, 2022. Since 2014, Elbers has served as the President & CEO of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines.

146.title: Guy emptied my pouch, stole money, cards at a Europe train station: Kangana
146.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut recalled that she was robbed by a person at a train station in Europe during one of her trips. "I had a Louis Vuitton pouch and a backpack. The guy was so sharp, he came and stole my money, a few thousand dollars...cards...I noticed that he'd emptied my pouch...my passport was with me," she said.

147.title: Hindu College professor booked over post on Shivling, says 'didn't expect threats'
147.article_body: Ratan Lal, an assistant professor from Delhi University's Hindu College, has been booked over an alleged derogatory Facebook post referring to claims of a Shivling being found at the Gyanvapi mosque. "I was not expecting threats and abuses for this statement...In our country, religious feelings get hurt over anything," Lal said after the complaint. He has sought police protection.

148.title: Ex-Tripura CM Biplab Deb named in 'fake CIA report', wife files complaint
148.article_body: Former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb's wife filed a police complaint alleging that a fake Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) report is being circulated on social media in the name of her husband. It is being circulated to infringe the security of the nation as a result of a deep-rooted conspiracy, she claimed. Deb on Saturday resigned as Tripura CM.

149.title: Love how everyone seems to know more about my life than me: Arjun amid wedding rumours
149.article_body: After rumours of his wedding with actress Malaika Arora, actor Arjun Kapoor took to his Instagram Stories to say that he loves how everyone seems to know more about his life than he does. Media reports had earlier said that Malaika and Arjun will have a winter wedding this year. Recently, he had also said people in India love gossiping.

150.title: BJP wants to take India back to 1990s when riots ensued: Owaisi
150.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi Mosque case, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the BJP wants to take the country back to the 1990s when riots ensued. "It's a fountain (inside the mosque)," Owaisi added. "If it happens like this then all the fountains of the Taj Mahal must be shut down," he stated.

151.title: Karnataka CM Bommai inspects rain-affected areas in Bengaluru
151.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Bengaluru, Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday inspected the rain-affected areas in the state capital. BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, state ministers R Ashoka and Munirathna also accompanied the CM during the inspection. Bengaluru saw heavy rains on Tuesday night, which led to severe flooding in many areas of the city.

152.title: Another suspect involved in robbing temples in Canada arrested
152.article_body: The Canadian police have arrested a fourth suspect in connection with the multiple incidents of robberies and vandalisations of religious places, which mainly included Hindu temples. The accused has been identified as Gurdeep Pandher, a 37-year-old resident of Brampton town. As many as 13 such incidents were reported between November 2021 and March 2022 in Ontario.

153.title: I'm scared with money after financial lows, always looking to save: Divyanka
153.article_body: Television actress Divyanka Tripathi said that she is always scared with money and is always looking to save. "Especially when you have seen too many lows...it's that way with me," she added. Divyanka also mentioned that her father was skeptical about her joining the industry and that he came and stayed with her for a week.

154.title: BBMP estimates 1,000 houses flooded amid rains in B'luru: Report
154.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has estimated that around 1,000 houses have been flooded due to the heavy rains in the city, according to a report. Two labourers have reportedly died amid heavy rainfall in the city on Wednesday. Meanwhile, the IMD has issued an orange alert for Bengaluru, predicting heavy rainfall for the next four-five days in the city.

155.title: Calcutta HC asks Partha Chatterjee to appear before CBI over SSC case
155.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Wednesday ordered West Bengal Minister and TMC leader Partha Chatterjee to appear before CBI by 6 pm today in connection with the alleged SSC recruitment irregularities. The order came after a division bench of court upheld the orders of a single bench on Wednesday that directed the CBI to inquire into alleged illegal appointments.

156.title: 2 critically injured after falling from Delhi's Nirman Bhawan building
156.article_body: Two people were critically injured after one of them allegedly fell from the sixth floor of the under-renovation Nirman Bhawan building in Delhi on Wednesday. The labourers received injuries on their head and hands, a fire department official said. The fire department rushed four fire tenders to the spot after receiving a call about the incident at 12:38 pm.

157.title: Depp told me about rage activities with Winona & Kate: Amber's friend
157.article_body: Amber Heard's friend iO Tillett Wright, in pre-recorded testimony played in court, said Johnny Depp had told him he experienced "great bouts of jealousy" in his relationships. Wright added Depp said it led to "a lot of drinking...a lot of rage activities". "Depp told me...that happened with...Winona Ryder....Kate Moss," Wright said. "Depp told me...that happened with Vanessa Paradis," he stated.

158.title: I'd love to recreate my iconic look of 'Poo' from 'Kabhi Khushi...': Kareena
158.article_body: In a recent interview, when actress Kareena Kapoor was asked which iconic look from her films she'd like to recreate, Kareena said, "Since 'Poo' from 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' is one of my most iconic characters, I would love to recreate that look of mine." Meanwhile, on the work front, Kareena has begun shooting for Sujoy Ghosh's next.

159.title: Inflation, unemployment making new records: Sachin Pilot criticises Centre
159.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot targeted the BJP-led central government over rising inflation and unemployment in the country. "Inflation and unemployment are making new records day by day under the directionless and failed governance of the central government," he tweeted. "With...wholesale inflation registering 15.08% in...April, inflation...has reached the highest level of 24 years," he added.

160.title: Mahinda makes 1st appearance in Sri Lankan parliament since quitting as PM
160.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa made his first appearance in parliament on Wednesday since stepping down as PM amid economic crisis. This comes a day after no-confidence motion against his brother and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was defeated in parliament. Mahinda Rajapaksa sought refuge at naval base last week as his house was set ablaze by protesters amid clashes.

161.title: Ratan Tata visits Taj Hotel in Nano without bodyguards; video goes viral
161.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was spotted visiting Taj Hotel in his Tata Nano without any bodyguard accompanying him, a video shared by Viral Bhayani showed. Bhayani said that Ratan Tata was escorted by the hotel staff. Several people praised him on social media, with a social media user saying, "Exemplary simplicity personified."

162.title: No one has ever won battle against farmers: Sidhu to Punjab CM
162.article_body: Following a protest staged by Punjab farmers near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday, Congress’ Navjot Singh Sidhu urged Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to "amicably" settle their issues. "No one has ever won a battle against the farmers," Sidhu tweeted on Wednesday. "Urge you not to go on a collision course with farmers...who are the backbone of Punjab’s economy," Sidhu added.

163.title: Top engineer who quit Apple over return-to-office policy joins Google: Report
163.article_body: Ian Goodfellow, who quit as Apple's Director of Machine Learning over the company's return-to-office policy, is joining Google parent Alphabet's AI unit DeepMind, Bloomberg reported. He worked in different capacities for Google since 2013, before joining Apple in 2019. He's best known for inventing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a class of machine learning frameworks.

164.title: UFOs spotted 400 times by US military, reveals US govt
164.article_body: The US military has had 11 close encounters with UFOs, a top Pentagon intelligence official has told Congress. In the first public hearing of its kind in over half a century, intelligence chiefs revealed they had recorded around 400 UFO sightings in total. Senior Pentagon officials said no evidence of extraterrestrial origins had been discovered so far.

165.title: Everyone is newborn care specialist: Nick Jonas on receiving parenting advice
165.article_body: When asked if people have been giving him advice on how to care for his newborn daughter, Malti, singer Nick Jonas said, "Turns out everybody I know is a newborn care specialist, all these PhDs I didn't know they had." When asked how his brothers have reacted to the baby's arrival, Nick said, "Amazing. They got kids of their own."

166.title: Even the biggest of players can struggle: Ishan on his form in IPL 2022
166.article_body: Talking about his form in the ongoing IPL season, MI opener Ishan Kishan said that even the best of cricketers can "struggle" at some point. He added, "I have seen the likes of Chris Gayle taking time (to start hitting)...Some day, you get a good start, some day, opposition bowlers come prepared." Ishan has scored 370 runs in 13 games.

167.title: These allegations are written by BJP: Cong MP on Hardik’s resignation
167.article_body: Soon after Hardik Patel resigned from primary membership of Congress saying that the party only played the role of a "roadblock", party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said that these allegations are written down by BJP. These allegations have not been made by someone who has quit Congress, Gohil added. "They just speak it out loud," Gohil stated.

168.title: T'gana govt owes Hyd civic body ₹5,258 cr in property taxes: RTI reply
168.article_body: The Telangana government owes the Hyderabad civic body ₹5,258 crore in property taxes, as per an RTI response. Some of the dues are pending for nearly 25 years, The Print reported. The police department has not paid dues of ₹420 crore for 12 years and the medical department owes ₹1,185 crore over the last 23 years, the RTI reply added.

169.title: Apple delays plan requiring employees to come to office 3 days a week
169.article_body: Apple has delayed its plan that required its employees to come to the office three days a week, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg. Apple said that the requirement is being delayed "for the time being", without providing a new date. The technology company still requires its employees to come to the office two days a week.

170.title: Give central contract to Umran Malik straight away: Ravi Shastri
170.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the BCCI should give central contract to SRH fast bowler Umran Malik "straight away". "Don't let him float around...keep him in the mix with the main players and let him learn by being around the Shamis and Bumrahs," Shastri added about the 22-year-old cricketer, who is the fastest bowler in IPL 2022.

171.title: Russian gymnast Kuliak banned for 1 year for wearing 'Z' war symbol on chest at World Cup
171.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak has been given a one-year ban for wearing 'Z' national war symbol on the podium at Apparatus World Cup in Qatar in March. Kuliak earned bronze in parallel bars final and displayed a letter 'Z' taped to his chest as he stood next to gold medallist, Ukraine's Illia Kovtun. He'll also have to return his medal.

172.title: 'Excuse me?' Amber after Depp's lawyer claims she got Aquaman due to actor
172.article_body: Amber Heard has denied the claim that Johnny Depp got her the role of Mera in 'Aquaman'. Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez, while cross-examining Heard during the trial, suggested Amber got 'Aquaman' due to Depp. To this, Amber said, "Excuse me? No...I got myself that role by auditioning." Earlier, Amber had said she "fought hard" to stay in 'Aquaman 2'.

173.title: Won't arrest MP Navneet Rana, her husband till June 9: Mumbai Police
173.article_body: Mumbai Police told a court they would not arrest Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana till June 9 in connection with Hanuman Chalisa case. June 9 is the date of hearing on police's plea seeking their bail cancellation. Rana and her husband were arrested after they had announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

174.title: No plans to block YouTube or cut ourselves off from internet: Russia
174.article_body: Russia's minister of communications Maksut Shadayev said Russia is not planning to shut YouTube in the country. He said that such a move would likely see Russian users suffer and should therefore be avoided. He added Russia doesn't want to cut itself off from global internet infrastructure, saying, "We think that Russia should remain a part of the global network."

175.title: Horatti resigns as chief of K'taka Legislative Council, joins BJP
