175.article_body: Former senior JD(S) leader Basavaraj Horatti on Wednesday joined the BJP after resigning as the Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council and MLC. He joined the BJP in the presence of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, among others. "[Horatti's] joining has strengthened the party...We'll...give him all the opportunities and respects he deserves," Bommai said.

176.title: Jamia Millia Islamia PG students stage protest against offline exams
176.article_body: A group of students pursuing postgraduate courses in Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) on Tuesday gathered in front of the office of the university's proctor and staged a protest against offline exams. The students raised slogans demanding that exams should be conducted online. Meanwhile, the university said as classes were conducted offline, the exams will also be conducted in physical mode.

177.title: 2 sisters, mother poison family over their objection to girls' marriage with boyfriends
177.article_body: Noida police have arrested five people including two sisters, their mother and their boyfriends for allegedly attempting to poison their family. Police said the sisters laced the dinner of four family members with a poisonous substance because of their objection to their marriage with their boyfriends. The victims were rushed to hospital after another family member found them unconscious.

178.title: Johnny Depp smiles as Amber Heard's lawyer imitates his voice, video viral
178.article_body: In a video that has been shared by several internet users, Johnny Depp can be seen smiling after Amber Heard's lawyer is heard imitating his voice. While talking about Depp not looking at Amber during her testimony, Amber's attorney Elaine Bredehoft can be heard saying, "She played...a tape...where Johnny said, 'You will not see my...eyes again'. Do you...recall that?"

179.title: Ayodhya Ram temple construction on schedule, says authority
179.article_body: The construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya is going as per schedule, an official statement said. Temple construction committee chairman Nripendra Misra said that the ground floor 'garbha griha' (sanctum sanctorum) will be complete by December 2023, while the remaining work will be done by December 2024. The construction of the plinth is expected to be completed by August 2022.

180.title: Ruchi Soya to acquire Patanjali's food retail business for ₹690 crore
180.article_body: Ruchi Soya on Wednesday said it'll be acquiring Patanjali Ayurved's food retail business for an amount of consideration of ₹690 crore. Post-acquisition, Ruchi Soya will be called 'Patanjali Foods' and will acquire Patanjali Ayurved's manufacturing plants in Padartha (Uttarakhand) and Newasa (Maharashtra). In 2019, Baba Ramdev's Patanjali had acquired Ruchi Soya through an insolvency process.

181.title: 4, including 2 children, missing from Pune found dead at Alibaug lodge
181.article_body: A 25-year-old woman, her two children, and a 29-year-old man who had gone missing from the Pune district on May 2 were found dead inside a tourist cottage in Alibaug on Tuesday afternoon. Police suspect the man and woman, who were allegedly in an extra-marital relationship, poisoned the three-year-old boy and five-year-old girl and then died by suicide by hanging.

182.title: LSG will undoubtedly target Shreyas with bouncers: Shastri
182.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer will have to "give himself time" to score runs in their final league match against LSG on Wednesday. Shastri added that LSG will "undoubtedly" target him with short balls and he'll have to show his "readiness against it". Shreyas is KKR's top run-getter with 351 runs in 13 games.

183.title: India test fires first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile
183.article_body: Indian Navy on Wednesday successfully carried out the maiden test firing of the first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile from a Seaking 42B helicopter, officials said. "This firing is a significant step towards achieving self-reliance in niche missile technology and reaffirms the Indian Navy's commitment to indigenisation," said a senior Navy official. The test was conducted in Odisha.

184.title: 2 booked for extortion threat of ₹10.85 crore to Pune builder
184.article_body: Pune's Hinjewadi Police have booked two persons for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10.85 crore from a city-based builder. The accused, identified as Chandu Laxmandas Ramnani and Kiran Chandu Ramnani, allegedly accused the builder of committing fraud by not having disclosed type of land he was carrying out construction on. Police have booked the accused under relevant sections of IPC.

185.title: Registration for K'taka govt's mango farm trips to start soon: Official
185.article_body: The Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited will soon begin registration for mango-picking tourism on its website. Mango tours to farms will be held on Sundays wherein the corporation will take people to the mango farms in the Ramanagara or Kolar districts from Bengaluru. Farmers sell fruits at a lesser price during the tour, an official said.

186.title: I'm trying to learn from every situation: Rahul Tripathi on 76(44) vs MI
186.article_body: SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, who scored 76(44) against MI on Tuesday, said he enjoyed batting at number three and he's trying to learn from every situation. On facing Jasprit Bumrah, Tripathi said, "Bumrah's a great bowler...and I was just looking to react to whatever he's bowling. Depends on how the wicket is playing, how I can counterattack at that point."

187.title: Newly married man loses hand as gift from sister-in-law's ex-lover explodes in Gujarat
187.article_body: A newly married man and his three-year-old nephew were critically injured after a wedding gift, which he allegedly received from his sister-in-law's ex-boyfriend, exploded in Gujarat's Navsari district. Apart from suffering severe injuries to his arms, head and eyes, his right wrist was cut off from the arm. A police complaint has been filed by his family.

188.title: Fire breaks out near judges' chamber in Delhi court, no one injured
188.article_body: A fire broke out near a chamber of judges on the second floor of the Rohini Court in Delhi on Wednesday. No injuries were reported in the incident, officials said, adding that five fire tenders were sent to the spot. The blaze started in an air-conditioner in a room near the judges' chamber, Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said.

189.title: Iran seizes foreign ship with smuggled fuel, detains crew members
189.article_body: Authorities in Iran have seized a foreign ship attempting to smuggle fuel out of the country and detained its crew members, state news agency IRNA reported on Wednesday. The ship, carrying over 5,50,000 litres of smuggled fuel, was seized in Gulf waters, the agency added. Iranian authorities have detained several ships in recent months for smuggling fuel in the Gulf.

190.title: Cong will be tail party in India, regional parties will take lead: TRS MLC
190.article_body: TRS MLC Kavitha Kalvakuntla reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks on regional parties and said his party will become a "tail party" in the country in future and regional parties will take lead. "Regional parties have a clear agenda for people. Rahulji should understand that even in Maharashtra they're in power because of a regional party there," Kavitha added.

191.title: One must do things the India way to be profitable there: Stellantis
191.article_body: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has said that western automakers can be profitable in India if they do things the "India way". He added that amid global disruption in Europe and China, India has a "bigger opportunity" to grow in the global automotive industry as well as within Stellantis. The firm will be launching its first EV in India next year.

192.title: In extortion bid, 4 goons set petrol pump on fire in Bihar's Gaya
192.article_body: Four goons allegedly set a petrol pump afire in an extortion bid in Bihar's Gaya. According to the employees, the goons, who arrived on two bikes, asked them to fill their tanks and refused to pay. Instead, they demanded extortion from them. When denied, they set the pump's vending nozzles, a parked school bus and bike on fire and fled.

193.title: Gujarat Congress busy ensuring chicken sandwich delivery for Delhi leaders: Hardik
193.article_body: Hardik Patel, who resigned as Gujarat Congress working president and left the Congress party on Wednesday, in his resignation letter claimed that big Congress leaders in Gujarat were "far away from issues of Gujarat". He added, "They are more focussed on ensuring that chicken sandwich for leaders who have come from Delhi is delivered on time!"

194.title: Researcher shows way Teslas could be unlocked using vulnerability
194.article_body: NCC Group researcher Sultan Qasim Khan has demonstrated the way he unlocked a Tesla using a vulnerability he said Tesla has been informed about. He unlocked a 2020 Tesla Model 3 using a vulnerability in the BLE technology on which the entry system relies. He added any smart locks using BLE technology could be unlocked in the same way.

195.title: 2 friends drown in Saharanpur's Yamuna canal while bathing
195.article_body: Two friends reportedly drowned in the Yamuna canal at Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur, police said on Tuesday. Yuvraj (20) and Devesh (21), along with another person, went to take a bath in the canal but accidentally moved to the deeper side. While locals managed to save the third person, the two deceased were washed away in the strong current, police said.

196.title: Criticising RBI for delayed rate hike is unfair: Ex-RBI Governor
196.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor D Subbarao on Wednesday said criticism that RBI is behind the delayed interest rate hike is unfair. "With credit growth currently only around 9-10%, the recent repo rate hike is unlikely to transmit very strongly," Subbarao said. Unlike most large economies, India is structurally supply-constrained and that itself is a safety valve for India against stagflation, he added.

197.title: Heat wave warning issued for several states over 5 days, IMD releases list
197.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for several states over five days. Heat wave conditions will likely be witnessed in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana and Madhya Pradesh on May 19 and 20. Maharashtra will likely witness heat wave conditions from May 18 to 21. Meanwhile, heat wave conditions are likely in Uttar Pradesh today and over Odisha on May 22.

198.title: BJP trying to divert attention from unemployment, inflation: Mayawati on Gyanvapi case
198.article_body: Reacting to the Gyanvapi mosque controversy, BSP chief Mayawati said that BJP and its associates are targeting religious places to divert people's attention from unemployment and inflation. "Years after independence, the manner in which religious sentiments of people are being instigated under a conspiracy, under the pretext of Gyanvapi, Mathura...will not strengthen the country," she added.

199.title: Wall collapses at salt factory in Gujarat's Morbi, at least 12 workers killed
199.article_body: At least 12 labourers were killed after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat on Wednesday, an official said. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. A rescue operation has been started and the injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital.

200.title: Historic day: MP CM on SC's nod to OBC reservation in local body polls
200.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision giving approval to OBC reservation in MP's local body polls, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "It's a historic day. Satyamev Jayate!" "It has been proven again that truth can't lose," he added. It was because of the Congress that it was earlier directed that polls would be held without OBC reservation, he further said.

201.title: Vedantu lays off 424 employees, CEO says 'I am truly sorry'
201.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Vedantu is laying off 424 of its 5,900 employees. "I am truly sorry," Vedantu CEO Vamsi Krishna told laid-off employees. In an e-mail to all Vedantu employees, he wrote, "External environment is tough. War in Europe, impending recession fears, and Fed rate interest hikes have led to inflationary pressures with massive correction in stocks...capital will be scarce."

202.title: Depp knows he's lying, I survived that man & I'm able to look at him: Amber
202.article_body: Amber Heard, when asked about Johnny Depp not looking at her during her testimony, said that he knows he is guilty and lying. "Otherwise why can't he look at me...I survived that man...and I'm able to look at him," Heard said. Depp's lawyer had asked Heard if it was true that actor promised that she'd never see his eyes again.

203.title: US approves COVID-19 vaccine booster for children aged 5 to 11
203.article_body: The United States has approved the administration of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine booster dose for children aged from five to 11 years. The US Food and Drug Administration said that the move will provide continued protection against COVID-19. The children in this age group will be given a low-dose shot of 10 micrograms, compared to 30 microgram doses for older people.

204.title: We intend to close the transaction and enforce Musk merger agreement: Twitter board
204.article_body: Twitter Inc's board said it plans to enforce its $44 billion agreement to be bought by Elon Musk, saying the transaction is in the best interest of all shareholders. "We intend to close the transaction," the board said on Tuesday in a statement to Bloomberg News. The proposed takeover includes a $1 billion breakup fee for each party.

205.title: Plea seeking demolition of Gyanvapi Mosque wall to be heard today
205.article_body: A plea seeking the demolition of a wall beneath the wazu khana of the Gyanvapi Mosque will be heard by a Varanasi court on Wednesday. Advocate Vishnu Jain, appearing for the petitioners, said that they want the wall to be demolished and that they should be allowed to go there. He added the court will pronounce its verdict today itself.

206.title: I was named after Abhishek Bachchan, had to change my name due to him: Krushna
206.article_body: Comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek revealed his mother, who was Amitabh Bachchan's fan, named him after the actor's son, Abhishek Bachchan. He said, "My name had to be changed and made Krushna, also because of Abhishek." "When I got into acting, I was told there's...an actor by the name of Abhishek...they told me not to keep my name as Abhishek," he added.

207.title: UK MP arrested over rape & sex offences spanning 7 years
207.article_body: The UK Police have arrested an unnamed Conservative MP on suspicion of rape and sexual assault. The man is in his fifties and the investigation into the alleged offences, which took place between 2002 and 2009, is ongoing, police said. The man also faces allegations of abuse of position of trust and misconduct in a public office.

208.title: Rahul Tripathi has got some real potential: Matthew Hayden
208.article_body: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, stating that the 31-year-old has "real potential to go all the way at the international level". Hayden added, "He is someone [who] is a dangerous striker of the ball, he can hit both sides of the wicket." Tripathi scored his third fifty of IPL 2022 against MI on Tuesday.

209.title: Video shows Heard, Franco in elevator night before she filed for divorce from Depp
209.article_body: Footage has emerged of Hollywood actor James Franco visiting Amber Heard at her apartment the night before she filed for divorce from Johnny Depp. The footage, showing Heard and Franco in an elevator, was played to jurors in the courthouse. Heard confirmed that it was Franco in the video and that they were going to her penthouse.

210.title: I used to pull a truck for 8 km: Shoaib Akhtar on how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed
210.article_body: Talking about how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said that he used to pull vehicles. "I began by running with tyres...Next, I started pulling small vehicles with my shoulders...[at night in Islamabad]," he added. He further said, "I started pulling a truck. I used to pull a truck for around 8 km."

211.title: Hyd-based devotee donates gold band worth ₹2 cr to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
211.article_body: A Hyderabad-based devotee has donated a band made of 4 kg of gold worth ₹2 crore to the Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi, the temple authorities said on Wednesday. The devotee, Parthsarthi Reddy, wished to donate the band for the throne of Saibaba's idol at the temple in 2016, but the procedure got delayed, the authorities added.

212.title: 'Narco tunnel' with a rail line uncovered between Mexico & US
212.article_body: US anti-narcotics agents have discovered a "narco tunnel" running from Mexico's Tijuana to a warehouse in US' San Diego. The tunnel, estimated to be about 1,744 feet long, had a rail track, electricity and a ventilation system. The agents were carrying out surveillance at a property previously used as a stash house for smuggling cocaine when they made the discovery.

213.title: Bus CCTV camera captures moment 2 buses collide head-on in Tamil Nadu, 30 injured
213.article_body: Around 30 people were injured in a head-on collision between two buses in Tamil Nadu's Salem district. The footage from the CCTV camera installed inside one of the buses, showing the collision, has gone viral. The video shows the bus driver thrown out of his seat while another man is seen hitting the windshield of the bus after the crash.

214.title: Anurag had told me 'Stop doubting yourself, you're good': Fatima on self-doubt
214.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said that filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her to "stop doubting" herself during the film 'Ludo'. "Dada had given me some sense of confidence...He used to tell me...you're good," she said, adding that she had self doubt during 'Modern Love: Mumbai', but director Shonali Bose said she was doing well.

215.title: Painting exchanged for cheese sandwich sold at auction for over ₹2 crore in Canada
215.article_body: A Canadian painting by artist Maud Lewis has been sold at an auction for CA$350,000 (over ₹2 crore) after coming to its owner in exchange for a grilled cheese sandwich. The painting was acquired by a chef named Irene Demas in the year 1973. "Mind you...It was a great sandwich, with a five-year-old cheddar and beautiful bread," Demas said.

216.title: Bus rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway in UP; 3 killed, 36 injured
216.article_body: A bus carrying 60 people rammed into a truck on the Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura leaving three dead and injuring 36 others, police said. The passengers were returning to Delhi after offering prayers in Vrindavan, police added. The bus rammed into the truck laden with building material from behind, police further said.

217.title: US planning military aid package for India to reduce India's dependence on Russia: Report
217.article_body: US is preparing a military aid package for India to reduce the country's dependence on Russian weapons, according to a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. The package under consideration would include foreign military financing of as much as $500 million, the report added. However, it is unclear when the deal would be announced.

218.title: 2 labourers found dead at pipeline work site amid heavy rain in B'luru
218.article_body: Two labourers were found dead amid heavy rainfall at a pipeline work site in Bengaluru's Ullal on Wednesday. "The dead have been identified as Devbharath from Bihar and Ankit Kumar from Uttar Pradesh. The labourers were at the site...around 7 pm, the water levels rose," police said. Heavy rain has led to water-logging in several parts of the city.

219.title: Demolition drive underway in Delhi's Kalyan Puri, AAP MLA Kuldeep Kumar detained
219.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Kuldeep Kumar was detained by Delhi Police during a protest against the anti-encroachment drive of East Delhi Municipal Corporation in the Kalyan Puri area on Wednesday. Visuals from the drive, which is underway, showed shops being demolished. Delhi government has sought a detailed report from the civic bodies over the 'bulldozer' drive from April 1.

220.title: Protesting is farmers’ right but sloganeering isn’t the way: Punjab CM
220.article_body: Following a protest held by Punjab farmers near the Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday, CM Bhagwant Mann said that it’s their right to protest but sloganeering is not the way to do so. "I'll make everything right...I am ready to meet them (farmers) but 'murdabad' (sloganeering) is not the way...At least put in efforts," Mann added.

221.title: The journey has been far from smooth: Bezos on 25 yrs of Amazon's IPO
221.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos shared a throwback picture of himself on social media on the occasion of 25 years of Amazon's IPO, saying the journey has been far from smooth. He also specified that the IPO share price was $1.50 on Twitter. "Lots of risk-taking, lots of invention, lots of mistakes, so much we still have to do better," he added.

222.title: BMC trims over 49,000 trees as part of pre-monsoon work
222.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) trimmed more than 49,167 trees as part of its pre-monsoon work this year after surveying around 1.50 lakh roadside trees. The civic body in its survey found that 1.02 lakh trees are in a dangerous condition. The trimming of the remaining trees will be completed before the monsoon using advanced machines, BMC officials said.

223.title: Canada bans entry of Putin, 1,000 other Russians over Ukraine war
223.article_body: Canada has announced a ban on the entry of Russia's President Vladimir Putin and 1,000 other Russian nationals in the country over the Ukraine war. Canadian Minister of Public Safety Marco Mendicino on Tuesday said, "In the face of the Putin regime's brutal attack, Canada stands with Ukraine and we will hold Russia accountable for its crimes."

224.title: Stopped from taking gun to fields for scaring cattle, UP man kills brother
224.article_body: A man killed his elder brother in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor after the latter stopped him from taking a gun into the fields. The accused, Brajveer, wanted to take his licensed double-barrel gun to the fields to scare away stray cattle. After being stopped, he got into an altercation with his elder brother and ended up firing at him.

225.title: Bengaluru Police recover 725-gram stolen gold; arrest 2
225.article_body: Police have arrested two people wanted in a theft case in Bengaluru and recovered 725 grams of stolen gold ornaments. North East Division Deputy Commissioner of Police, Anoop A Shetty, took to Twitter and congratulated the Amruthahalli Police for solving the case. Separately, the Amruthahalli Police have arrested two people involved in pickpocketing and robbing mobile phones from bus passengers.

226.title: Man held in Punjab for helping terror suspects to get fake RCs
226.article_body: A man was arrested from Punjab’s Kharar for allegedly helping some suspected Khalistani terrorists, who have been arrested, to procure fake registration certificates (RCs) for two stolen vehicles. The accused along with his associate, who was arrested earlier, used to purchase the vehicle from a third accused and they had sold two vehicles to the terror suspects.

227.title: Kane Williamson to miss rest of IPL 2022 for birth of his second child
227.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson will miss the rest of the IPL 2022 as he is exiting the bio-bubble to return to New Zealand for the birth of his second child. "Here's everyone at the #Riser camp wishing Kane Williamson and his wife a safe delivery and a lot of happiness," SRH posted on social media.

228.title: Hyd Police arrests Nigerian man for cheating women on matrimonial site
228.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a Nigerian man for cheating women on an international matrimonial site. The 24-year-old accused, who impersonated himself as a non-resident Indian (NRI) and cheated women, was arrested from Delhi following a complaint lodged in Rachakonda, police added. The accused contacted the complainant stating that he was an NRI and wanted to marry her, police stated.

229.title: Malayali vlogger Rifa Mehnu died by suicide, autopsy report suggests
229.article_body: The autopsy report of Malayali vlogger Rifa Mehnu, whose body was exhumed after her family raised doubts over her death, has suggested her death was caused by suicide. The 20-year-old vlogger was found dead in her house in Dubai by her husband Mehnu (Mehnaz) in March. "Police would proceed with the investigation into the case registered against Mehnaz," police said.

230.title: PhonePe to acquire WealthDesk, OpenQ, reportedly for $70 million
230.article_body: PhonePe has said it will acquire wealth tech platforms WealthDesk and OpenQ. The acquisitions together will amount to around $70 million, media reports said. PhonePe will reportedly buy WealthDesk for roughly $50 million. WealthDesk's founder and the entire team will be working as a part of PhonePe and it will continue to remain an open platform for all players.

231.title: Finland and Sweden formally apply to join NATO amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine
231.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Finland and Sweden on Wednesday formally applied to join the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO). "This is a historic moment, which we must seize," NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. "You are our closest partners, and your membership in NATO will increase our shared security," Stoltenberg added.

232.title: Class 12 boy stabs friend to death in Tamil Nadu for repeatedly calling him 'girlish'
232.article_body: A Class 12 student stabbed his friend to death in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi district for repeatedly calling him 'girlish'. Police said that the victim continuously teased his classmate over his looks despite the latter's objection. Police registered a case of murder and sent the accused to a correctional centre. The accused also claimed the victim used to touch him inappropriately.

233.title: Actress Ketaki Chitale sent to 14-day judicial custody over post on Sharad Pawar
233.article_body: Thane court has sent Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale to 14-day judicial custody after her police custody ended. Ketaki had been arrested for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against NCP chief Sharad Pawar. She had claimed that Pawar was corrupt and had remarked upon his illness, appearance and voice in a Facebook post.

234.title: Supreme Court allows OBC reservation in local elections in Madhya Pradesh
234.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed the Madhya Pradesh government to implement Other Backward Classes (OBC) reservation in local body elections in the state. The court further directed the state Election Commission to notify the local body elections in one week. MP government had sought a 35% reservation for OBCs in the three-tier panchayat and urban local body polls.

235.title: We'll adapt the story to modern times: Producer Murad on Tezaab's remake
235.article_body: Film producer Murad Khetani, who has bankrolled films like 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Thadam' Hindi remake, has acquired the rights of the N Chandra directorial 'Tezaab'. According to reports, Murad will soon begin the pre-production work on the 'Tezaab' remake. Speaking about it the producer said, "We will adapt the story to modern times." The film was released in 1988.

236.title: Security tightened at Aurangzeb's tomb after MNS says it should be destroyed
236.article_body: The Maharashtra government ordered deployment of additional security outside Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad after MNS leader Gajanan Kale called for destroying it. Kale also criticised AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi for visiting the tomb and said, "The Maharashtra government should take action against Owaisi...If no action is taken, then the MNS will take the matter into its own hands."

237.title: Unfollowing Kangana: Payal Rohatgi in Instagram note after losing 'Lock Upp'
237.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi, after losing the reality show 'Lock Upp', took to Instagram to share a note, saying that she is "unfollowing Kangana". "Kangana and lot of A-grade celebrities who came as guests on 'Lock Upp' called me bad**s...Maybe they didn't know...the meaning of it...in middle of the show and on finale Kangana realised it," she wrote.

238.title: Narine is tried and tested option as opener for KKR: Pragyan Ojha
238.article_body: Ahead of KKR's last league match of IPL 2022, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said Sunil Narine should open for KKR in the absence of Ajinkya Rahane. "Narine is a tried and tested option...at the top of the order. He is an attacking option. With that you can pick a player in the middle order as a dynamic option," Ojha explained.

239.title: Man accused of robbery surrenders with 'don’t shoot me' placard in UP
239.article_body: An alleged robber surrendered to police in UP's Budaun with a "don't shoot me" placard hung around his neck, an official said. The man along with his accomplice purportedly robbed a trader of ₹5 lakh. He approached the police station with the placard reading "Don't shoot me, I am surrendering due to the fear of police," a police official said.

240.title: Indrani granted bail in daughter Sheena's murder case, SC says 'Already spent 6.5 yrs in jail'
240.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to Indrani Mukerjea, the prime accused in the case involving her daughter Sheena Bora's murder, saying that she has "already spent 6.5 years in jail". In December 2021, Mukerjea wrote a letter to the CBI claiming that Sheena is alive and is in Kashmir. The CBI had refuted the former media executive's claim.

241.title: Whenever India faced challenges, Cong leaders were enjoying abroad: Hardik Patel
241.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel, who quit Congress on Wednesday, said, "Whenever our country faced challenges and when the Congress needed leadership, Congress leaders were enjoying abroad." He added, "Whenever I met with the senior leadership, I always felt leaders were...more engrossed in what messages they had received on their mobile."

242.title: Hoax bomb call delays Gorakhpur-Bandra Humsafar Express by over 3 hours
242.article_body: The Gorakhpur-Bandra Humsafar Express (19092) was delayed by three and a half hours on Tuesday after it received a hoax bomb call on Twitter. A person identified as Milan Rajak tweeted that terrorists have planted a bomb inside the train to blow it up. However, after a thorough search, nothing incriminating was found on the train, the railway police informed.

243.title: ‘Return empty beer bottles’: Brewers in Germany flag shortage
243.article_body: Germany is facing a shortage of beer bottles, brewers in the country have warned. The chief executive of a German brewers' group, Holger Eichele, said the situation is extremely tense and that "we will see shortages by summer at the latest". Eichele advised the consumers to return the empty beer bottles as soon as possible to ease the situation.

244.title: Musk responds after Twitter employee says 'he is special needs, he has Asperger's'
244.article_body: Elon Musk has responded after a journalist shared a video in which a Twitter employee calls the Tesla CEO "special needs" and says that he has Asperger's. "Twitter exec trashing free speech & mocking people with Asperger's," Musk wrote. "I can't even take what Musk says seriously," the employee can be heard saying in the video.

245.title: It's up to Tilak now to prove Rohit Sharma right: Gavaskar
245.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said it's up to Tilak Varma to prove Rohit Sharma right in saying that the 19-year-old could be an all-format player for Team India. "It's up to Tilak to work that little bit extra, get his fitness going, get a little tighter as far as the technique is concerned and prove Rohit right," stated Gavaskar.

246.title: 1 dead after fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar
246.article_body: At least one person died after a fire broke out at a banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar on Tuesday, police said. The victim was found unconscious and was declared dead at a hospital. "A fire that started at the ground floor of the banquet hall in PS Bharat Nagar area has been contained promptly," Delhi Police tweeted.

247.title: Send sweets to Mohan Bhagwat during his stay in WB: Mamata to police
247.article_body: Ahead of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's West Bengal visit, CM Mamata Banerjee directed the police to remain vigilant and ensure that no riots break out during his stay. "Send him sweets and fruits on behalf of the administration. He should feel that we welcome our guests," Banerjee further said. Bhagwat will be staying in West Bengal's Keshiary for four days.

248.title: Racket providing fake educational certificates busted in Panipat, 1 held
248.article_body: A racket providing fake educational certificates was busted in Panipat, following which one member of the gang was arrested by the Crime Investigation Agency of the Panipat Police. The accused told the police that he was running this racket for the past five years. The gang members used to get a certificate for classes 10 and 12 at ₹5,000.

249.title: Is this legit: Musk on Twitter engineer's 'free speech' leaked recording
249.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to the leaked recording of a top Twitter engineer saying the platform does not believe in free speech, saying, "Is this legit?" The video also showed Siru Murugesan saying Twitter employees "hated" Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. Responding to Musk, American columnist Benny Johnson claimed Twitter has acknowledged that the video is authentic.

250.title: I don't believe I'm hated; people are obsessed with me: Kangana on trolls
250.article_body: When asked about dealing with trolls and hatred, actress Kangana Ranaut said that she doesn't feel she is hated at all. "I find it very hard to believe that I might be hated," she said. "It's...difficult for me to believe. Either they love me, or they are obsessed. I don't think I'm hated as such," she added.

251.title: Tanker carrying chemical overturns, rams into divider in Thane; 2 injured
251.article_body: A tanker that was carrying 10 tonnes of chemical overturned in Thane after the driver reportedly lost control of the vehicle. The tanker then rammed into a divider. Two people were injured in the incident. Reports said that after the vehicle overturned, the chemical spilled over the road, causing traffic congestion on the Western Expressway Highway.

252.title: Burqa-clad terrorist attacks newly opened wine shop in J&K's Baramulla
252.article_body: A burqa-clad terrorist riding pillion on a bike that stopped near a newly opened wine shop in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla walked towards the shop and threw a grenade inside through the porthole window. The explosion killed one employee, leaving three others injured. They were rushed to a hospital. Police have cordoned the area and a search is on.

253.title: New York City raises COVID alert from 'medium' to 'high' as cases rise
253.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, New York City has raised its COVID-19 alert level from "medium" to "high". The rating means there is a high COVID-19 community spread in the city and pressure on the health care system is substantial.  Health authorities have advised New Yorkers to wear a face mask in all public indoor settings and crowded outdoor spaces.

254.title: Indian Army launches rescue operations in flood-hit  Assam
254.article_body: The Indian Army on Tuesday launched rescue operations in various parts of Assam's flood-hit Cachar and Hojai districts. "Security forces comprising of Army & Assam Rifles of Masimpur launched...rescue operations...on 17 May. Approximately, 500 villagers were rescued by the forces," Guwahati's Defence PRO tweeted. Meanwhile, around 100 people were rescued from the Hojai district by Gajraj Corps.

255.title: Yamuna water level 5.5 ft below normal, Delhi minister reviews situation
255.article_body: Water level in Yamuna was recorded at 669 feet on Tuesday at Delhi's Wazirabad barrage. This is 5.5 feet below the desired level of 674.5 feet. Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain carried out an on-site review of situation on Tuesday. "Due to...Haryana government's insufficient water release...water level at Wazirabad barrage has dropped from...its typical 674.5 feet to...669 feet," Jain said.

256.title: SC orders release of Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Perarivalan after 31 yrs in jail
256.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday ordered the release of AG Perarivalan, one of the convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. A bench of Justices L Nageswara Rao, BR Gavai and AS Bopanna passed the order on Perarivalan's plea seeking the suspension of his life sentence. AG Perarivalan had been behind bars for around 31 years.

257.title: Hardik Patel quits Congress, says 'Party played role of roadblock on national issues'
257.article_body: Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel has resigned from the primary membership of Congress party. He said, "Be it the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, revocation of Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, implementation of GST - India wanted solutions...Congress only played the role of roadblock." He added, "I believe after this step, I'll be able to work positively for Gujarat's people."

258.title: What will we eat, if we won’t work: Delhi labourers amid heatwave
258.article_body: Amid the unprecedented heatwave condition in Delhi, the construction workers working in the national capital said that they have no other option except to work for their livelihood. "If I take a day off then people at home will starve. We don't have any other options except to work. I have to look after my children," a construction worker said.

259.title: Europe ditching Russian oil is economic suicide: Putin
259.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said the EU wouldn't be able to impose a ban on Russian oil imports. "Some EU states, in whose energy balance the share of Russian hydrocarbons is especially high, won't be able to do this for...long time, to ditch our oil," Putin said. Europe would be committing an "economic suicide" by banning Russian oil, he added.

260.title: Centre pressuring states to purchase imported coal: Raj CM Gehlot
260.article_body: Centre is pressuring states to purchase imported coal, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot alleged. The price of imported coal is more than three times the price of coal being given by Coal India Limited, he added. "Centre had issued an advisory in 2021 to Rajasthan for 4% imported coal blending...in April, it has been made mandatory to buy 10%," Gehlot added.

261.title: Spain Cabinet clears Bill to grant paid leave during menstruation
261.article_body: The Spanish Cabinet has cleared a Bill that seeks to grant paid sick leave to women experiencing pain during menstruation. "We are advancing feminism. Women should be able to decide freely about their lives," said Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez. Spain would become the first country in Europe to bring such a law, provided the Bill passes in the Parliament.

262.title: Car was badly damaged, seat belts saved us: NCP MLA after road accident
262.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader, Sangram Jagtap, whose car hit a state transport bus on the Pune-Mumbai expressway on Tuesday, said that the car was "badly damaged". "Seat belts and airbags saved us," Jagtap, who was travelling with driver and two others in the car, said. He added that it was bus driver's fault but no case has been filed.

263.title: Till the second last over, I thought we had it: Rohit Sharma
263.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said he thought they had the game till about the second last over of their chase of SRH's 193-run total. He added, "Credit to Sunrisers, they held their nerve pretty well at the back end." MI were 175/6 after 18 overs and needed 19 runs to win the game when Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowled a maiden over.

264.title: Understand Himachal before commenting: CM on Sisodia's 'education' remark
264.article_body: Soon after AAP's Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said the education system in Himachal Pradesh is "in shambles", CM Jai Ram Thakur told Sisodia to understand the Himalayan state before making any comment on its people or education system. Sisodia said the government schools in the state lack basic infrastructure. He added that 47% of those schools don't have a principal.

265.title: India reports 1,829 COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths in 24 hours
265.article_body: India has reported 1,829 COVID-19 cases, 2,549 recoveries and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,569 COVID-19 cases and 19 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,647, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,293.

266.title: Pak influencer accused of starting forest fire as her 'Fire erupts...' video goes viral
266.article_body: A female Pakistan influencer has been criticised after she posted a TikTok video with a forest fire in background amid severe heatwave across the country. After the video, captioned "Fire erupts wherever I am", went viral, social media users said that the forest fire was started by the influencer named Humaira Asghar. However, Asghar said she didn't start the fire.

267.title: School girls in uniform fight on street in Bengaluru, pull each other's hair
267.article_body: An unverified video of a group of girls in school uniform attacking each other on the street in front of Bengaluru's Bishop Cotton Girls' School has gone viral on social media. In the video, the girls can be seen slapping each other and pulling each other's hair. One girl can also be seen taking out a stick to beat others.

268.title: Narasimha Rao brought Places of Worship Act for appeasement: BJP MLA
268.article_body: BJP MLA Brijmohan Agrawal said that the Places of Worship Act was brought by former PM PV Narasimha Rao for appeasement politics. "Lord Shiva was worshipped in Gyanvapi before 2001 but due to that Bill, namaz started happening. Even today 'Nandi Maharaj' sits in front of the mosque," said Agrawal. He also questioned Chhattisgarh government's stand on loudspeakers for azaan.

269.title: Pollution killing 90 lakh people per year, Africa hardest hit: Study
269.article_body: Pollution of all types has been causing around 90 lakh premature deaths each year since 2015, a study has revealed. The release of the study's findings reveals that overall pollution deaths haven't changed much from 2015 to 2019. The study offered a list of the 10 countries most affected by pollution-related deaths, showing Africa being the worst affected region.

270.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with 1 match each remaining?
270.article_body: With teams left with one match each in IPL 2022 league stage, only GT have qualified for playoffs so far. RR, LSG, DC, RCB, KKR, PBKS and SRH are in contention for remaining three playoffs spots. RR and LSG have 16 points each, while DC and RCB are on 14 points each. KKR, PBKS and SRH have 12 points each.

271.title: Mumbai Rajdhani Exp completes 50 yrs of service, to get Vande Bharat coaches
271.article_body: The Mumbai Rajdhani Express, which connects the national capital and the financial capital, completed 50 years of its journey on Tuesday. "In a few years, the train coaches will be upgraded to Vande Bharat coaches," said a senior Western Railway official. Currently, 25 pairs of Rajdhani Express trains are operational across India, the Railway Ministry stated.

272.title: Delhi govt seeks report from BJP-run civic bodies amid 'bulldozer' row
272.article_body: Delhi government has sought a detailed report from the three BJP-run Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) amid the 'bulldozer' row. Notably, various anti-encroachment drives are being conducted in the national capital by civic bodies. "More than 80% of Delhi can be called illegal and encroached upon. Does that mean you will destroy 80% of Delhi?" CM Arvind Kejriwal had said.

273.title: CBI arrests close aide of Karti Chidambaram in bribe for visa case: Report
273.article_body: The CBI has arrested S Bhaskar Raman, a close associate of Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram in an ongoing visa corruption case, reported ANI. The CBI on Tuesday raided the premises of P Chidambaram and Karti Chidambaram, alleging that the latter facilitated visas for Chinese nationals for a power project of the Vedanta Group in Punjab in return for bribes.

274.title: Will break arm of any man who raises hand at a woman: NCP's Supriya Sule
274.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule said that she will "break the arm" of any man who raises a hand at a woman in Maharashtra. "I will go there myself and file a case...will break his arm and hand it over to him," Sule added. This comes a day after a woman NCP worker was allegedly assaulted by BJP workers in Pune.

275.title: Demands of homebuyers, developers in Navi Mumbai to be resolved: UD Min Shinde
275.article_body: Maharashtra's Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde said that measures have been taken to provide immediate relief to thousands of homebuyers and more than 400 affected projects in Navi Mumbai region. "There were problems faced by developers due to restrictions imposed on heights of buildings...I myself will be writing to ministry to allow building heights as per earlier CCZM," he said.

276.title: Felt that I lost respect as a housewife; decided to return to work: Neena
276.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said she took a break from work to enjoy her married life. She added, "I got married and I thought..'I have done enough work'...But...(the people I did everything for), they didn't have time for me." Neena said she felt that she was losing respect as a housewife. "I realised I needed to work," she added.

277.title: Never thought I'll go to Cannes one day when I had started off: Nawazuddin
277.article_body: After making eight trips to the Cannes film festival in the previous years, this year for the first time actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui was invited by the Government of India to represent the country. Speaking about it, he said, "I had never thought...that I'll go to Cannes one day when I had started off." "It's the mecca of cinema," he added.

278.title: Bihar magistrate's house robbed, family assaulted at gunpoint
278.article_body: A judicial magistrate's house in Bihar was allegedly robbed and his family was assaulted at gunpoint by three armed men. Magistrate Maheshwar Nath Pandey was in court, away from home, when the incident occurred. Pandey's wife said that the perpetrators, who came looking for her husband, pulled out weapons and took away cash and jewellery.

279.title: Pune district sees 62 new COVID cases, active cases rise to 299
279.article_body: Pune district in Maharashtra on Tuesday reported 62 new cases of COVID-19, taking the number of active cases in the district to 299. Of the new cases, 52 were reported in Pune city, seven in Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) limits and three in Pune rural. A total of 18.32 million COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in Pune.

280.title: It's nice to break the losing streak: Williamson on 3-run win vs MI
280.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said it was nice to break their five-match losing streak after defeating MI. He added, "Had a few games where momentum wasn't on our side and we couldn't wrestle it back. All in all a very good performance." SRH now have 12 points from 13 games and will play their final league match against PBKS.

281.title: Netflix lays off 150 employees citing slowing revenue growth
281.article_body: Netflix has announced that it has laid off around 150 employees, mostly in the US, as it faces slowing revenue growth. "These changes are primarily driven by business needs rather than individual performance, which makes them especially tough," the firm said. The reductions come less than a month after Netflix reported its first subscriber loss in a decade.

282.title: 8-year-old boy dies due to intense heatwave in Punjab
282.article_body: An eight-year-old boy, Mehakpreet Singh, the resident of a village in Punjab's Sangrur district allegedly died after getting sick due to intense heatwave on Monday. "My son had got fever, loose motion and was vomiting. Doctors told us that he got dehydrated due to the heatwave," the deceased's father said. "However, no one provided proper treatment," he added.

283.title: Water-logging in many areas in B'luru amid heavy rains, IMD issues orange alert
283.article_body: Bengaluru witnessed water-logging in many areas amid heavy rains on Tuesday night. JP Nagar, Jayanagar, Lalbagh, Chickpet, Majestic, Malleswaram, and Rajajinagar, among others were the affected areas. Notably, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued an orange alert for urban and rural districts of Bengaluru, predicting heavy rainfall for the next four-five days in the city.

284.title: Punjab farmers protest at Chandigarh-Mohali border; CM says open to talks
284.article_body: After being stopped from entering Chandigarh, Punjab farmers sat on protest near Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday. Farmer leader Jagjit Singh said protestors would break barricades and move towards Chandigarh if Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann fails to hold meeting with them by Wednesday. Mann said he's open for talks but hollow slogans cannot break his resolve to check depletion of groundwater.

285.title: Honeymoon pic of Depp with 2 black eyes shown to court, Amber Heard says 'It's photoshopped'
285.article_body: During actor Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, the court was shown a picture from the couple's honeymoon, wherein Depp was seen having two black eyes as he posed with Heard and three other men. "I've seen this picture before and he’s not injured in it. This one is photoshopped," Heard claimed.

286.title: Mame Khan becomes first folk artist to open red carpet for India at Cannes Film Festival
286.article_body: Rajasthani singer Mame Khan on Tuesday became the first folk artist to open red carpet for India at Cannes Film Festival. Khan was seen dressed in a traditional Rajasthani ensemble that included a vibrant pink kurta underneath an ethnic embroidered coat. Khan has sung for several Bollywood films like 'Luck By Chance' and 'No One Killed Jessica', among others.

287.title: Officials' immature response increased complexity in fighting COVID-19: Kim Jong-un
287.article_body: During a meeting amid the COVID-19 outbreak in North Korea, leader Kim Jong-un said that the "immaturity in the state capacity for coping with the crisis" increased the "complexity and hardships" in fighting the pandemic. North Korea has reported over 17 lakh patients with fever symptoms and 62 deaths as of Tuesday evening.

288.title: Chandigarh to get dedicated anti-narcotic task force, anti-dark net cell
288.article_body: A dedicated anti-narcotic task force will be set up in Chandigarh which will be headed by an Inspector General (IG)-rank officer. The decision was taken during the second state-level Narco Coordination Centre (NCORD) meeting chaired by UT Adviser Dharam Pal on Tuesday. A dedicated anti-dark net cell will also be constituted to check dark web drug trade in the city.

289.title: No compromise on security issues of Kashmiri Pandits: IGP Kashmir
289.article_body: Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar on Tuesday said there will be no compromise on the security-related issues of Kashmiri Pandits. "The agenda of militants is to create fear among you. We will have to fight them jointly. If you get scared, then their agenda will get fulfilled," Kumar told the protesting Kashmiri Pandits at Sheikhpora transit accommodation.

290.title: 7 get life sentence for murder of former UP MLA, his aide
290.article_body: Seven people, including gangster Dhruv Singh alias Kuntu Singh, have been sentenced to life imprisonment in the murder of former MLA Sarvesh Singh 'Seepu' and his associate in UP's Azamgarh in 2013. A fine of ₹50,000 has also been imposed on each of them. The incident occurred over a fallout of a political rivalry, according to the prosecution.

291.title: Tesla to hold second artificial intelligence day on Aug 19: Musk
291.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the firm will be hosting its second artificial intelligence day on August 19. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," he tweeted. The company held its first AI Day in August last year and a Battery Day in September 2020.

292.title: We didn't aim for 200 vs MI but went with the flow: SRH's Priyam Garg
292.article_body: SRH's Priyam Garg, who opened their innings along with Abhishek Sharma against MI, said they didn't plan to score around 200 runs but went with the flow. "It [was] 10-15 runs short given how we were going but it was a good score [that] our bowlers can defend," he added. SRH scored 193/6 and won the match by three runs.

293.title: Arrested for looting petrol pump, Punjab man kills self inside police station
293.article_body: A man, who was arrested by Punjab's Moga Police in a loot case, allegedly died by suicide inside the washroom of the lock-up of Baghapurana Police Station. The deceased was arrested for looting ₹17,000 from a petrol pump in December last year in Nathoke village. He was scheduled to be produced before the court on Tuesday.

294.title: Bombay HC rejects bail of man who induced friends to invest in crypto
294.article_body: The Bombay High Court rejected pre-arrest bail plea of a man accused of allegedly inducing two friends to invest ₹21.27 lakh in cryptocurrency TRON. According to the police, the accused told his friends that value of 1 TRON is equivalent to ₹10 and by investing in it they would earn a profit of 0.50% per TRON per day.

295.title: Apple delays plan to have US staff in office 3 days a week: Report
295.article_body: Apple is indefinitely delaying its plan to have US employees work from office three days a week due to rising COVID-19 cases, Bloomberg reported. It had planned for such a return starting May 23. It's still expecting US workers to come to the office two days per week. The staff is also required to wear masks in the common area.

296.title: Hyd growing not just in IT but in many sectors: T'gana minister
296.article_body: Hyderabad has been growing not just in the information technology sector but in many sectors like life sciences, aerospace and defence, Telangana Industry Minister KT Rama Rao said. "Seven years ago...two million square feet office space was getting leased out....has now reached 11 million square feet," he added. Our job as a government is to create more infrastructure, Rao stated.

297.title: Platform ticket price at Pune Railway Station increased to ₹30 till May 31
297.article_body: The platform ticket price at the Pune Railway Station has been increased from ₹10 to ₹30 till May 31. This has been done to control crowd at the platforms during summer vacation. "Our appeal to passengers and their relatives or friends, who come to drop or pick up, is to avoid crowding at the premises," Pune railway division spokesperson said.

298.title: Haven't done anything wrong, I was betrayed: Officer removed from Gyanvapi survey
298.article_body: Ajay Mishra, former advocate commissioner appointed for conducting the survey of Gyanvapi Mosque has said, "I've not done anything that reveals the secrecy of the matter." Mishra said he had been betrayed by advocate Vishal Singh who had "taken advantage of his trusting nature". Mishra had reportedly engaged a private person for the videography, who leaked information to the media.

299.title: We girls had male friends; they took us out, paid our bills in Delhi: Kangana
299.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she and the other girls who lived with her in Delhi had made their male friends their drivers. "They used to take us out...they used to pay bills...for us," she said, adding that she experienced a "cultural shock" after coming to Mumbai. "In Mumbai...even if you are on date...you have to pay equal," she added.

300.title: Towing of vehicles must be re-introduced: Bengaluru's new police chief
300.article_body: Towing vehicles in no-parking zones must be re-introduced, Bengaluru's new Police Commissioner CH Pratap Reddy said. Towing must be brought because "handling traffic issues will be a challenge since people are returning to normal life after the COVID-19 pandemic", he added. Karnataka government suspended towing of vehicles in Bengaluru in February after allegations of corruption and harassment.

301.title: 3 more top Twitter employees leave ahead of Elon Musk's takeover
301.article_body: Twitter lost three more senior employees, including two vice presidents, ahead of Elon Musk's takeover. Ilya Brown, a VP of product management; Katrina Lane, VP of Twitter Service; and Max Schmeiser, head of data science, are all leaving the company, a Twitter spokesperson confirmed. Earlier, Twitter Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal fired two top executives.

302.title: 16-year-old fan's letter to MS Dhoni goes viral, CSK captain says 'Well written'
302.article_body: A 16-year-old fan's letter to CSK captain MS Dhoni went viral on social media. The official Twitter handle of CSK shared pictures of the framed letter. "If I am 7% the person you are someday, I'd consider myself blessed," a part of the letter read. Dhoni signed the letter, writing, "Well written. Best wishes."

303.title: Hanuman idol shifted to temple after clashes in MP's Neemuch
303.article_body: The Hanuman idol, which was placed near a dargah leading to communal clashes in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, has been shifted to a temple, said police. Five FIRs were registered and 10 people were detained by police on Tuesday. Several people were left injured in the clashes during which stones were pelted and a mosque was set on fire.

304.title: Anurag Thakur shares pics with Indian contingent at Cannes red carpet, calls it 'Historic'
304.article_body: Information & Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur walked the red carpet at 75th Cannes Film Festival with Indian delegation on Tuesday. Anurag shared pictures on Twitter, wherein he can be seen at the red carpet with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, R Madhavan and others. He called it a "historic moment" for India as it became the first country of honour at the festival.

305.title: Chinese plane carrying 132 people was intentionally crashed: Report
305.article_body: Flight data from one of the black boxes from the China Eastern Airlines jet indicates that someone in the cockpit intentionally crashed the plane, The Wall Street Journal reported citing people familiar with preliminary assessment by US officials. The aircraft crashed on March 21 in the mountains of Guangxi, killing all 123 passengers and nine crew members aboard.

306.title: 13-yr-old returning home on bicycle run over by car in Delhi, dies
306.article_body: A 13-year-old boy who was returning home on a bicycle was run over by a car in Delhi's Hauz Khas on Saturday and he died on Tuesday at a hospital, police said. The driver of the car has been arrested, police added. The deceased was with a friend and they were returning home after they went for a swim.

307.title: Musk's SpaceX poised to become most valuable US startup: Reuters
307.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk-owned SpaceX is poised to become the most valuable US startup as its valuation jumped to over $125 billion in an ongoing share sale in the secondary market, surpassing Stripe, Reuters reported. The shares jumped in valuation from October when SpaceX's shares were sold at $56 apiece. No new shares have been issued in the secondary offering.

308.title: Won't arrest doctors in kidney transplant case yet: Pune Police to HC
308.article_body: Pune Police on Tuesday told Bombay High Court that it'll not arrest the doctors named in an FIR in an alleged case of organ transplant malpractice yet. The court had asked the police why were they in such a hurry to arrest highly qualified doctors. Fifteen people, including some doctors of Ruby Hall Clinic, have been booked in this case.

309.title: SRH defeat MI by 3 runs, stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race
309.article_body: SRH defeated MI by three runs on Tuesday to stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race. SRH are eighth on the points table with 12 points. With the win, SRH ended their five-match losing streak in the tournament. Meanwhile, bottom-placed MI became the first team to record 10 losses in the tournament.

310.title: Bengaluru man claims family was left stranded by Ola cab, says 'drove to pick them up'
310.article_body: An Ola Cabs customer from Bengaluru has shared an experience his family underwent while using the service to Mysuru. "An hour and a half into the trip some rowdies come...and...threaten...driver to pay up his past instalments...else they'll confiscate the vehicle," he added. Stating that his family members were "abandoned on the highway", he said he drove to pick them up.

311.title: 'Haryana not releasing our share of water' says Delhi Minister; Haryana CM denies
311.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday alleged Haryana government was depriving the national capital's residents of their rights by withholding water. Meanwhile, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said Delhi is being supplied its share of 1,050 cusecs of water. "On the contrary, the AAP government of Punjab is not giving Haryana's share of water," the CM further claimed.

312.title: This time we played as a team: Srikanth on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
312.article_body: Commenting on the difference between earlier Thomas Cup editions and the recent one, shuttler Kidambi Srikanth said, "This time we really played as a team [rather] than like an individual sport." He added, "We bonded really well, backed each other and really believed that we could do it." India defeated Indonesia 3-0 to win their maiden Thomas Cup on Sunday.

313.title: He's nowhere near finished article: Bishop on SRH pacer Umran Malik
313.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop praised SRH pacer Umran Mailk, saying the 22-year-old's "pace distinguishes him from every other bowler around the country and beyond now". He added, "It's been heartening watching his control improve as IPL has gone along...Malik is still a work in progress. He's nowhere near the finished article." Malik has been consistently bowling above 150 kmph.

314.title: China's 'Zero-COVID' policy is unsustainable due to Omicron: WHO
314.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus claimed that China's 'Zero-COVID' policy is unsustainable because of the highly infectious nature of the Omicron variant. "We know the virus better and we have better tools...so that's why the handling of the virus should actually be different from what we used to do at the start of the pandemic," he said.

315.title: 2 tiger cubs rescued from villagers in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni
315.article_body: Forest department officials said that two tiger cubs which were allegedly injured by angry villagers were rescued by their team in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. "The cubs, around 14-15 months old, might have come there to drink water. The villagers surrounded them with sticks," Chief Conservator of Forest (Seoni Circle) said. However, the official denied that the cubs were injured.

316.title: Ugandan national arrested for smuggling ₹7-crore cocaine in Mumbai
316.article_body: A Ugandan national, Brandon Sulpisious Migadde, was arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence at the Mumbai airport and cocaine worth ₹7 crore was recovered from him. Officials said that his x-ray report confirmed the presence of the foreign substances in his stomach, after which he was admitted to Sir JJ Hospital. Drugs were later recovered from him, they added.

317.title: Reliance Retail to enter beauty sector with 400 stores: Report
317.article_body: Reliance Retail is looking to enter the beauty and cosmetics segment with around 400 exclusive stores in the coming years, the Economic Times reported. The company will reportedly open two kinds of outlets, a multi-brand store modelled on Sephora and a chain of value products targeting the mass market. It'll open a high-end store, code-named Tiara, within months, ET reported.

318.title: LIC's debut 2nd-worst among 11 global companies that listed this year after raising $1bn
318.article_body: Investors of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) lost over ₹50,000 crore on the stock's debut on May 17. Its first-day performance makes for the second-worst debut among 11 global companies that listed this year after raising at least $1 billion through first-time share sales. The shares ended 7.8% lower than the IPO price of ₹949 after losing 9.4% earlier.

319.title: Difference of opinion doesn't mean anything is wrong with MVA: Patil
319.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said, "Congress, NCP and Shiv Sena are working together. If there's a difference of opinion on a big or small issue, it doesn't mean there is something wrong with the Maha Vikas Aghadi." Three parties should work together to fight against BJP, he added. His comment came after Nana Patole called NCP a 'backstabber'.

320.title: BSE appoints ex-RBI Deputy Governor SS Mundra as Chairman
320.article_body: BSE Limited on Tuesday announced that its board has appointed Public Interest Director SS Mundra as the Chairman of the stock exchange. Mundra retired as Deputy Governor of RBI in July 2017 after a stint of three years. Prior to that, he was Bank of Baroda's Chairman and MD. He will replace Justice Vikramajit Sen.

321.title: RBI sold $20.1 billion in spot foreign exchange in March
321.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) sold a net $20.1 billion in the spot foreign exchange market in March to defend rupee against dollar, its monthly bulletin showed. RBI said its net outstanding forward dollar purchases rose to $65.79 billion in March compared to $49.11 billion in February. In March, the rupee hit its first record low for 2022.

322.title: Murder of Qandeel Baloch in Pak was heinous honour killing: Alankrita
322.article_body: Filmmaker Alankrita Shrivastava, who will be directing a film on late Pakistani social media star Qandeel Baloch, has said that she was shaken up when Qandeel was murdered in Pakistan. "It was a heinous honour killing...I started watching Qandeel's videos repeatedly, and I was fascinated," she added. Qandeel was strangled to death in 2016 by her brother Muhammad Waseem.

323.title: US Air Force claims it successfully tested a hypersonic weapon
323.article_body: The US Air Force on Monday claimed that it had successfully tested a hypersonic weapon. The test was conducted on Saturday off the coast of Southern California when a B-52 bomber released an Air-launched Rapid Response Weapon (ARRW), it added. The ARRW achieved "hypersonic speeds five times greater than the speed of sound", it further said.

324.title: G7 using Russia's reserves for Ukraine is outright theft: Kremlin
324.article_body: Kremlin said on Tuesday that G7 countries seizing frozen Russian reserves and spending them on behalf of Ukraine is "outright theft". Kremlin's reaction came as German Finance Minister Christian Lindner reportedly said that he's open to using funds from Russian reserves for reconstruction of Ukraine amid its invasion. Earlier, US also proposed transfer of Russian oligarchs' assets to help Ukraine.

325.title: Govt considers selling part of BPCL instead of full stake: Report
325.article_body: Centre is considering inviting bids for a 20%-25% stake in Bharat Petroleum Corp Ltd (BPCL), instead of selling its entire 52.98% holding, Reuters reported quoting government officials. The officials added that the discussions about the plan were in the early stages. Initially, the government had aimed to raise $8-$10 billion from selling its full stake in BPCL.

326.title: SA batter Zubayr Hamza suspended for 9 months for using banned substance
326.article_body: South Africa batter Zubayr Hamza has been suspended for nine months by ICC for a doping violation under the ICC Anti-Doping Code. The ban was backdated to March 22, 2022, the date Hamza accepted a provisional suspension. Hamza provided an out-of-competition sample on January 17, 2022, in which the prohibited substance Furosemide was found.

327.title: Terrorists attack newly opened wine shop in J&K, 1 worker killed
327.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a newly opened wine shop in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district on Tuesday, killing one worker and injuring three others. All the four employees of the shop hailed from the Jammu division, a police spokesperson said. The area was cordoned off and a search was on to nab the culprits.

328.title: Not here to judge, will enjoy creative process: Deepika on being Cannes jury
328.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, speaking about being a jury member at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, stated, "I don't think any of us have the capacity to judge...critique...or...criticise." The actress further said that she would like to enjoy the creative process. "The idea is to remind ourselves of...audience or of that young child who's grown up watching movies," Deepika added.

329.title: Pathaan's music might be biggest one coming up: Sheykhar Ravjiani
329.article_body: Music composer Sheykhar Ravjiani, speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan, has said, "'Om Shanti Om', 'Chennai Express', 'Happy New Year', all projects done with sir are an honour to be a part of." Speaking about composing songs for 'Pathaan', he said, "This one is a big and very special one coming up...might be...biggest one coming up so far."

330.title: Won't target any community: K'taka Minister on 'anti-conversion' law
330.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said that "anti-conversion" law will not target any community in the state and promised a strict implementation of the law. He said, "It is in the Constitution that there can't be forced conversions. We have just brought provision for punishment in case it happens." He added the step was taken to maintain law and order.

331.title: Indonesia to end outdoor mask mandate as COVID-19 cases decline
331.article_body: Indonesia is set to lift its outdoor mask mandate from Wednesday onwards amid a "more controlled" pandemic situation, President Joko Widodo said on Tuesday. Masks will still have to be worn indoors and on public transportation, he further said. Additionally, fully vaccinated travellers arriving in Indonesia will no longer need to undergo COVID-19 tests to enter the country.

332.title: Tom Harrison steps down as ECB CEO, to be replaced by Clare Connor on interim basis
332.article_body: Tom Harrison has announced that he is stepping down as the CEO of England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) after seven years in the role. Clare Connor, the former England Women captain, has taken over the position on an interim basis. "I believe now is the right time to bring in fresh energy to continue this work," Harrison said.

333.title: Lack of confidence: Punjab Cong as AAP asks Centre for security help
333.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja Warring criticised the Punjab government for seeking additional security forces from the Centre, saying AAP government lacks confidence in itself. It is also an admission of failure on the security front, Warring said. "Past experience has been bitter as the state accumulated substantial debt due to security expenses," Warring added.

334.title: Britain to end its overseas aid spending in China
334.article_body: The UK on Tuesday announced that it would end all overseas aid spending in China. "We'll work with China to tackle global challenges, but we can make a bigger difference spending UK aid where it is more needed," UK's Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng tweeted. The UK had spent around 13 million pounds on aid to China last year.

335.title: My sister taught Depp how to snort cocaine using tampon applicator: Heard
335.article_body: Amber Heard, who was cross-examined by ex-husband Johnny Depp's legal team in the ongoing defamation trial against her, stated that her sister Whitney Henriquez taught Depp how to snort cocaine using a tampon applicator. She was shown a picture that she clicked of cocaine lines on the breakfast table. Depp is suing Heard following her claim of surviving domestic violence.

336.title: Hope SC would do complete justice: Owaisi on Gyanvapi Mosque case
336.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday hoped the Supreme Court will do "complete justice" in the Gyanvapi Mosque case. This comes after SC directed the Varanasi DM to safeguard the "Shivling" reportedly found inside the mosque complex without affecting the right of Muslims to enter and worship. Furthermore, the SC has set the next date of hearing on May 19.

337.title: Growth forecast range reasonable despite monetary tightening: CEA
337.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said India's growth forecast is "reasonable" despite monetary tightening. He added that global price shocks posed "upward risks to domestic inflation", which, over time and with increase in interest rates, would dampen demand and put downward pressure on energy prices. The risk of sustained high inflation "is somewhat low" in India, he said.

338.title: Uncle-aunties of Juhu gave us chocolates 'on udhaar': Zayed Khan
338.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan has recalled his childhood days when he had no money, but the "uncles" and "aunties" in Juhu gave him chocolates or ice creams "on udhaar (on loan)". He further stated, "It was a different time where people lived on trust and [goodwill]. Those were the days." The actor further revealed that he is locally nicknamed 'Jayed'.

339.title: Was typecast after 'Banoo...', producers stopped casting me: Divyanka
339.article_body: Actress Divyanka Tripathi has revealed that she was typecast after her 2006 TV show 'Banoo Main Teri Dulhann'. "I was typecast like Tulsi (Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi)...Parvati (Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii). So producers stopped casting me," she stated. "They were like 'You've become like Tulsi...Parvati, so we can't cast you again, no one will see you'," she added.

340.title: Mandi traders in MP go on 2-day strike against ban on wheat export
340.article_body: Mandi traders in Madhya Pradesh have gone on a two-day strike against the sudden ban on export of wheat. "The Union government should have given time of at least 15 days before taking such a decision," Mandi Traders Association president said. Traders association added that over 3,000 trucks full of wheat from Madhya Pradesh are lined up at Mumbai port.

341.title: When we won IPL in 2014: Russell on his favourite moment with KKR
341.article_body: On being asked his favourite moment with Kolkata Knight Riders, all-rounder Andre Russell said, "When we won the IPL in 2014, that was an amazing experience." Russell has, so far, scored 330 runs and taken 17 wickets in ongoing IPL. On Saturday, Russell became the fastest batter in terms of balls faced to achieve 2000-run mark in history of IPL.

342.title: Textile units in Tamil Nadu protest amid high cotton, yarn prices
342.article_body: Textile units in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur, Karur and Erode have shut their shops in protest against the Centre amid high cotton and yarn prices. "You could buy one kg of yarn for ₹200 around 18 months ago, whereas the same amount will now fetch only 400 gm of yarn," M Raja Shanmugam, President of Tiruppur Exporters' Association (TEA) said.

343.title: Blast in Karachi market leaves 1 dead, over 10 others injured
343.article_body: A blast in a market in Pakistan's Karachi on Monday killed one person and injured over 10 others. Notably, this is the second blast in the city within the span of a week. Condemning the attack, PM Shehbaz Sharif said that enemies of people's lives and property will be dealt with iron hands.

344.title: Those guilty will be punished: Maha Minister on NCP, BJP clash
344.article_body: After NCP and BJP workers clashed at an event attended by Union Minister Smriti Irani in Pune, Maharashtra Minister Dilip Walse Patil said the guilty will be punished, irrespective of what party they belong to. NCP also alleged that a woman party member was assaulted by BJP workers. "To beat a woman office-bearer or any woman is objectionable," he added.

345.title: Declassified photos, footage of UFOs shown at US Congress hearing
345.article_body: The US' Pentagon on Tuesday showcased declassified footage of UFOs to US Congress. It included a reflective spherical object that zoomed past an aircraft, with naval intelligence deputy director Scott Bray, saying, "We don't have an explanation for this specific object." It was the first open congressional hearing on UFOs in more than 50 years.

346.title: Russia moving nuclear-capable missiles to Finland's border, say reports
346.article_body: Russia is moving nuclear-capable Iskander missiles towards its border with Finland, after the latter announced its intentions to join NATO, reports have said. A purported video clip of the Iskander missiles moving towards Vyborg, a Russian town on the Finnish border, has also surfaced online. At least seven Iskander missiles were spotted along Vyborg, reports said.

347.title: Brian Lara shares old video of his son playing with Andrew Symonds, says 'Thank you Roy!'
347.article_body: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara took to Instagram to share a throwback video of his son playing with late Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds. "Thank you Roy! I will let my son know how lucky he was that day to spend some time with you," Lara wrote alongside the video. Symonds passed away aged 46 in a road accident on Saturday.

348.title: Focus must be more on Indian cinema than fashion at Cannes: Deepika
348.article_body: Deepika Padukone said people should be talking about the celebration of Indian talent and cinema at the Cannes Film Festival. The actress added fashion is fun, however, doesn't deserve "pages and pages of news". She said, "I hope...Indian media has learned from...last experience and realises...we have the power to...change that narrative...talk about what a big moment this is for India."

349.title: Amber denies defecating in Depp's bed, says his dog had 'bowel control issues'
349.article_body: Amber Heard has denied leaving faeces in Johnny Depp's bed during the defamation trial. She further alleged that one of Depp's dogs had "eaten Depp's weed as a puppy and had bowel control issues for life". When asked if she committed any sort of prank, Amber replied, "Absolutely not...I don't think that's funny. I don't know what grown woman does."

350.title: Out of all MI bowlers, I've been impressed by Sams the most: Harbhajan
350.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has said MI all-rounder Daniel Sams has impressed him the most among all the bowlers in the team in ongoing IPL.
