"He has a great slower delivery and that's what has allowed making such a comeback...he's a good investment for the future," he added. Sams has picked up 11 wickets in his last seven matches for MI.

351.title: No shortage of fertilisers here, India to be self-reliant soon: Mandaviya
351.article_body: Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Tuesday that there is no shortage of fertilisers in India, adding that the country will become self-reliant in the sector soon. He further said that by 2025, India will achieve self-sufficiency in urea production. The government is promoting organic farming, which would greatly reduce fertiliser consumption in the country, he added.

352.title: Bumrah becomes 1st Indian pacer to take 250 wickets in T20 cricket
352.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has become the first Indian pacer to take 250 wickets in T20 cricket. Overall, he is the fifth Indian to take 250 wickets in T20 cricket. Ravichandran Ashwin, Yuzvendra Chahal, Piyush Chawla and Amit Mishra are the other Indian bowlers to have taken at least 250 T20 wickets.

353.title: India appoints Naveen Srivastava as next ambassador to Nepal
353.article_body: India on Tuesday appointed Naveen Srivastava as its next ambassador to Nepal. Srivastava, who is currently serving as the additional secretary in the Ministry of External Affairs, will take up the assignment shortly. The ministry announced his appointment a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Lumbini in Nepal.

354.title: It happens only in India: Chirag Shetty on receiving call from PM after Thomas Cup win
354.article_body: Talking about receiving call from PM Narendra Modi following India's first-ever Thomas Cup win, shuttler Chirag Shetty said, "I've never seen a Prime Minister actually calling a sports team after a win." He added, "It happens only in India. It motivated us to a whole new level...We were very happy...he took out time from his busy schedule and congratulated us."

355.title: Which Indian male wrestlers have been selected for CWG 2022?
355.article_body: As many as six Indian male wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. Ravi Dahiya (57 kg), Bajrang Punia (65 kg), Naveen (74 kg), Deepak Punia (86 kg), Deepak (97 kg) and Mohit Dahiya (125 kg) were selected during the trials to represent the country at the event. The CWG 2022 will be held in Birmingham.

356.title: Asian Para Games 2022 postponed due to rising COVID-19 cases in China
356.article_body: The Asian Para Games 2022, which were scheduled to take place from October 9-15 in Hangzhou, China, have been postponed until 2023 amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in the country, the organisers announced on Tuesday. The decision comes in less than two weeks after the Hangzhou Asian Games were postponed indefinitely on May 6 due to the same reason.

357.title: CBI to probe paper leak of Himachal police constable recruitment exam
357.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government on Tuesday decided to hand over the state police constable recruitment exam's question paper leak case to CBI. It was transferred to CBI to ensure a fair and impartial probe, CM Jairam Thakur said. As many as 73 people have been arrested and over ₹8 lakh has been seized in connection to case.

358.title: Finland's Parliament approves proposal to apply for NATO membership
358.article_body: The Finnish Parliament on Tuesday approved the proposal for Finland's membership of the NATO. Of the 200 lawmakers, 188 voted in favour and eight against the application, Speaker Matti Vanhanen said. Recently, Finland and Sweden had announced their decision to join the military alliance in a historic policy shift prompted by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

359.title: CBI probe ordered against WB minister over appointment of daughter as teacher
359.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Tuesday directed CBI to interrogate West Bengal Minister of State for School Education PC Adhikary over alleged appointment of his daughter as a teacher in a state government-aided school. This comes after a candidate's petition claimed she was deprived of the job despite having secured higher marks than the minister's daughter in the recruitment examination.

360.title: Pune municipal commissioner acting as NCP agent, conduct early polls: BJP
360.article_body: Pune's municipal commissioner is working as an NCP agent now that the Supreme Court has allowed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to hold Pune civic polls after monsoon, said Pune BJP chief Jagdish Mulik. Maharashtra government will try to delay polls as BJP is coming back to power and thus we demand to hold elections earlier, Mulik added.

361.title: TV actress Pallavi Dey's live-in partner arrested after she was found dead at her flat
361.article_body: The Kolkata Police on Tuesday arrested late Bengali TV actress Pallavi Dey's live-in partner Sagnik Chakraborty in connection with her death. Dey was found dead at her rented flat in Kolkata's Garfa area on Sunday. This comes after the police interrogated Chakraborty for several hours on both Sunday and Monday.

362.title: Ensure zero cross-border infiltration in J&K: Amit Shah to forces
362.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday chaired a review meeting on the security situation in J&K and directed security forces and police to pro-actively conduct coordinated counter-terrorism operations in J&K. "[Shah] said to fulfill PM Narendra Modi's vision of a...peaceful J&K, security forces should ensure zero cross-border infiltration to wipe out terrorism in the Union Territory," the MHA said.

363.title: 2 pilots' licences suspended for 1 yr after flight overshot runway in MP
363.article_body: Aviation regulator DGCA has suspended the licences of two pilots of Alliance Air for one year after an aircraft with 55 passengers on board overshot the runway by 10 metres in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur in March. The plane had skidded off the runway when it suffered a tyre burst while landing. All passengers and crew members were safe.

364.title: US Prez Biden to host Sweden, Finland leaders amid NATO membership bid
364.article_body: US President Joe Biden will host his Finnish counterpart Sauli Niinistö and Sweden's PM Magdalena Andersson for a meeting at the White House on Thursday. The meeting will discuss the countries' membership bid in NATO as well as the state of European security, the White House said. Finland and Sweden will submit their respective applications to NATO on May 18.

365.title: Rare Palestinian banknote sold for ₹1.3 crore, 1,400 times its original value
365.article_body: A single rare Palestinian banknote has been sold for £140,000 (around ₹1.3 crore), which is 1,400 times its original printed value, at an online auction. The note was found in a donation box at a charity shop in UK's Essex by Oxfam volunteer Paul Wyman. It was issued to high-ranking officials during the British Mandate in Palestine in 1927.

366.title: Maha man climbing building to commit theft falls off pipe, dies
366.article_body: One person died and his associate was seriously injured after they slipped and fell from a metal pipe while trying to scale a building to allegedly commit theft in Maharashtra, police said. According to a police officer, the accused were spotted by the watchman of the building. Further investigation in the matter is underway, the officer added.

367.title: 64 police personnel now guard CM Kejriwal: Delhi Police to HC
367.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday told the Delhi HC that the security at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence has been increased and a proposal to curtail public entry on the road outside it is under consideration. Total strength of police personnel on CM's security now stands at 64 with 20-22 personnel at his residence round-the-clock, Senior Standing Counsel Sanjay Lao said.

368.title: US to ease restrictions on remittances and flights to Cuba
368.article_body: The US has said it'll expand flights to Cuba, take steps to ease restrictions on American travellers to the Caribbean nation and lift restrictions on remittances that immigrants can send to people on the island. Currently, the US has limited family remittances to $1,000 per quarter. "With these actions, we aim to support Cubans' aspirations...for greater economic opportunities," it added.

369.title: Rat bites female patient's eye at Rajasthan hospital's stroke unit
369.article_body: A 55-year-old female patient was allegedly bitten in her right eye by a rat at the stroke unit of the MBS hospital in Rajasthan's Kota on Monday night. The patient with Guillain-Barré syndrome has been admitted to the stroke unit for the last 45 days. The hospital's Deputy Superintendent, Samir Tondon, said the incident will be probed.

370.title: 1 hurt as fire breaks out at Delhi banquet hall, 12 tenders deployed
370.article_body: A fire broke out at the Atlantis banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar on Tuesday. Twelve fire tenders have rushed to the spot and the process of extinguishing the fire is underway, according to Delhi Fire Service. A 30-year-old man, who sustained injuries in the incident, had to be rushed to the hospital in an unconscious state.

371.title: 'Had crush on Chunky in 90s, glad nothing happened', jokes Farah Khan
371.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan, while speaking to Ananya Panday on 'The Khatra Khatra Show', said that she had a crush on Chunky Panday in the 90s. She added that she befriended Chunky's wife Bhavana to work with her then-boyfriend. "After working with Chunky, I'm glad...nothing happened between us. I also thanked Bhavana for getting married to him," she jokingly added.

372.title: DC have a never-say-die attitude, we're fighters: David Warner
372.article_body: After DC registered a 17-run win against PBKS in IPL 2022 and broke into top four on the points table, DC opener David Warner said the team has a "never-say-die" attitude. "We are fighters and we play to the best of our abilities..there's a hunger and desire to help each other out as we care for each other," he stated.

373.title: Education system in Himachal Pradesh is in shambles: Manish Sisodia
373.article_body: AAP's Manish Sisodia, who's on a visit to poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, said on Tuesday that education system in state is "in shambles". Sisodia stated that government schools in state lack basic infrastructure, adding that 47% of those schools also don't have a principal. "If AAP...can provide quality education in Delhi in five [years], why couldn't BJP...do so [here]," he asked.

374.title: BJP's negative thinking & hate politics must be defeated: Rahul
374.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said the negative thinking of the BJP and its politics of hate have to be defeated if the country has to progress. Taking to Twitter, Rahul said the people's issues included "income and inflation", while the BJP's focus was on "riots and dictatorship". Earlier on Monday, Rahul had accused the BJP of "dividing" people.

375.title: Proving flights done successfully, waiting for AOC: Jet Airways
375.article_body: Jet Airways has successfully operated all proving flights and is now waiting for the grant of air operator certificate (AOC) by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), owner Jalan-Kalrock Consortium said. The airline concluded its second set of proving flights with around 31 people, reportedly including DGCA officials, on Tuesday. It had conducted three proving flights on Sunday.

376.title: 26-year-old trans model-actress found dead in her house in Kerala
376.article_body: A 26-year-old trans model-actress Sherin Celin Mathew was found dead in her apartment in Kerala's Kochi on Tuesday. A police officer said that a case of unnatural death has been registered and prima facie, it appeared to be a suicide. She was reportedly suffering from depression due to some personal differences with her friends.

377.title: Russia jumps 6 positions to be India's 4th-largest oil supplier
377.article_body: Russia became the fourth-largest oil supplier to India in April, tanker tracking data showed. Russia's share in India's oil purchases rose to a record 6%, about 2,77,000 barrels per day (bpd) in April, up from about 66,000 bpd in March, when it was in 10th position. Meanwhile, the share of US oil imports almost halved to 3% in April.

378.title: Hrithik gave me his crash mat, refused to shoot until I got it: Rohit on 'Kaabil'
378.article_body: Actor Rohit Roy has said that his 'Kaabil' co-star Hrithik Roshan refused to give a shot in which they had a fight scene because the set didn't have a crash mat. "He called for his own personal crash mat and laid it down for me...A superstar like him...made sure that his co-actor was safe," Rohit said.

379.title: US FDA flags production procedure at Aurobindo Pharma's Hyd plant
379.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued six observations to Aurobindo Pharma's facility in Hyderabad's Jadcherla. As per US FDA observations, Aurobindo Pharma's Unit-VII doesn't follow written procedures for production or process controls and its batch production and control records don't include complete information. Appropriate controls aren't exercised over computers, US FDA added.

380.title: India's real fintech user base isn't more than 10-15 cr: Zerodha CEO
380.article_body: Online stockbroker Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol that he believes India's actual fintech user base is not more than 10-15 crore. "Eliminating merchants, there may be 20-30 crore unique UPI users...maybe 50% of those can consume fintech," Kamath said. He added, "It's going to be tough because money has been raised as if the market is 40-50 crore."

381.title: Indian Oil posts highest-ever revenue by any Indian firm in FY22
381.article_body: India's biggest oil firm Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) on Tuesday reported standalone revenue of ₹7.28 lakh crore in FY22, the highest-ever revenue reported by any Indian company, IOC Director (Finance) Sandeep Gupta said. IOC also reported its highest-ever net profit of ₹24,184.10 crore in FY22. IOC earned $18.54 on turning every barrel of crude oil into fuel in Q4 FY22.

382.title: Amit Shah holds high-level meeting on killings of Kashmiri Pandits
382.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday, in a high-level meeting, reviewed the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir following several targeted killings, including that of Kashmiri Pandits, in the Union Territory. The meeting, attended by J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Union Home Secretary AK Bhalla, also took stock of preparedness for Amarnath Yatra, scheduled to begin on June 30.

383.title: Former CBI Director approaches Delhi HC over Twitter 'blue tick'; fined ₹10,000
383.article_body: Delhi High Court has fined former CBI Director M Nageswara Rao ₹10,000 while rejecting his plea seeking restoration of his Twitter blue verification tick. The court, in his previous appeal, had refused to intervene and asked Rao to approach Twitter. "Your client seems to have a lot of free time. Do you want a return gift from us," it stated.

384.title: Mom would've been happy to watch my 1st film: Arjun on 10yrs in B'wood
384.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, speaking about completing 10 years of his career in Bollywood, stated that his mother would have been happy to watch his first film 'Ishaqzaade'. The actor further said that he is financially independent and stopped taking money from his father filmmaker Boney Kapoor after he became an actor. "My mother...brought us up very well," Arjun added.

385.title: Suspended CEO Ankiti Bose proposes repaying Zilingo's $40 mn-debt
385.article_body: Ankiti Bose, the suspended Indian-origin CEO of Singapore-based fashion startup Zilingo, has proposed to repay the company's entire outstanding debt worth $40 million. As per reports, this would let her gain more equity in the firm. "After Bose's suspension in April, the company missed the repayment which was due in the same month," a source told the Financial Express.

386.title: Ex-diplomat shares pic of beachside road in India, says 'Most beautiful cycling route'
386.article_body: Erik Solheim, a former Norwegian diplomat, on Tuesday tweeted an aerial shot of a beachside road in Udupi, Karnataka and wrote, "World's most beautiful cycling route?" The picture was taken by photographer Dhenesh Annamalai, who had shared it on his Instagram account. The photographer had revealed the location as Maravanthe Beach in his post.

387.title: Not the end of the road: Sachin Bansal as RBI rejects banking licence application
387.article_body: Navi Chairman Sachin Bansal said, "It is not the end of the road for us," after Navi's subsidiary Chaitanya India Fin Credit Private Limited's application for a universal banking licence was rejected by the RBI. "There are many things to explore including re-applying," said Bansal, who previously co-founded Flipkart. "We haven't received written communication from RBI yet," he added.

388.title: Delhi sees 393 new COVID cases, 2 deaths, positivity rate at 3.35%
388.article_body: Delhi has reported 393 new cases of COVID-19 and two deaths in the last 24 hours, according to data shared by the health department. The national capital witnessed a slight dip in the daily positivity rate, which stood at 3.35% on Tuesday, compared to 3.37% on Monday. There are a total of 2,910 active cases of COVID-19 in the city.

389.title: Challenge for India to sustain 8-9% growth for 30 yrs: NITI Aayog CEO
389.article_body: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Tuesday said the challenge for India is to "sustain high growth of 8-9% over the next three decades". Kant added that it will be difficult for India to grow at high rates without technological leapfrogging. Government's role should be in public policy and the policy should create wealth through the private sector, he added.

390.title: Abu Dhabi's IHC invests ₹15,400 crore in three Adani firms
390.article_body: Abu Dhabi-based global strategic investment company, the International Holding Company (IHC), on Tuesday announced the completion of an investment transaction worth ₹15,400 crore (around $2 billion) in three Adani portfolio companies. IHC has invested ₹3,850 crore each in Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises, a statement from Adani said.

391.title: Asked Aamir Khan to talk about Manikarnika like I did for PK: Kangana
391.article_body: Kangana Ranaut revealed that she called Aamir Khan for her film 'Manikarnika' and asked him to come for its trial and talk about it like she did for his films like 'Dangal' and 'PK'. She further called Salman Khan a "very good friend" of hers, adding that she attended Arpita Khan and Aayush Sharma's Eid party because of Salman's invitation.

392.title: 163 BEST mini buses stay off roads due to strike in Mumbai
392.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) officials said that 163 mini buses of BEST's private contractor firm MP Group stayed off roads due to a strike over non-payment of salaries. This is the second strike by the contractor's drivers in a month. BEST spokesperson said that of the 275 mini buses of MP Group, 112 were operational.

393.title: RBI rejects six bank licence applications, including Sachin Bansal's
393.article_body: The RBI rejected six applications to set up banks under the guidelines for 'on tap' licensing of Universal Banks and Small Finance Banks. These include an application by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal's Chaitanya India Fin Credit, a microfinance entity of Navi Technologies. The RBI said the applicant was not found suitable under guidelines for 'on tap' licensing of Universal Banks.

394.title: Astronaut shares pics of rare 'Blood Moon' eclipse taken from space
394.article_body: European Space Agency astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti shared pictures of the recent total lunar eclipse from aboard the International Space Station. "A partially eclipsed Moon playing hide-and-seek with our solar panel," wrote Cristoforetti, along with the pictures. The recent eclipse had resulted in the occurrence of the rare Blood Moon that was visible from many parts of the world.

395.title: Thane man gets life term for raping, impregnating minor daughter
395.article_body: A 45-year-old man was sentenced to life imprisonment by the Thane sessions court under the POCSO Act for allegedly raping and impregnating his minor daughter. The sessions court also reportedly issued a penalty of ₹25,000 on the accused. The incident came to light in 2017 when the minor complained to her mother about abdomen pain.

396.title: Boy jumps into Thane creek, remains untraceable after 2-day search op
396.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, who jumped into a creek from Kasheli Bridge in Thane's Bhiwandi on Sunday, is still untraceable after a two-day search operation. "Due to high tide, the search operation was hampered on Sunday and had to be stopped after two hours. On Monday, we continued the operation but we were unable to find him," a civic official said.

397.title: 2 terrorist associates of Lashkar-e-Taiba arrested in J&K's Budgam
397.article_body: Two terrorists associated with the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) have been arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam. They were arrested during a joint operation of the Jammu and Kashmir Police and security forces. Incriminating materials, explosive material and ammunition, including one hand grenade, two pistol magazines and 15 AK-47 rounds, were also recovered from their possession, the police said.

398.title: 96 dengue cases reported in Delhi from January to mid-May: Report
398.article_body: At least 96 dengue cases have been reported in Delhi between January and mid-May, a report citing the South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) stated. No deaths were reported due to the vector-borne disease so far, the report added. Civic body officials said that this year, dengue cases are being recorded early due to the congenial weather for mosquito-breeding.

399.title: TMC will be in position to form govt in Goa by next polls: Kirti Azad
399.article_body: Trinamool Congress' (TMC) Kirti Azad said on Tuesday that party will be better positioned to form government in Goa by next Assembly polls. He added that TMC's performance was better than BJP and Congress' initial electoral stints in state. Azad took over as Goa unit incharge after ex-party state president Kiran Kandolkar resigned citing bleak prospects for TMC in Goa.

400.title: MI to bowl first against SRH, both teams make 2 changes each
400.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. MI have included Mayank Markande and Sanjay Yadav in place of Hrithik Shokeen and Kumar Kartikeya. Meanwhile, Priyam Garg and Fazal Farooqi have replaced Shashank Singh and Marco Jansen in SRH's playing XI.

401.title: Gyanvapi-like incidents deliberately stirred up by BJP: Akhilesh
401.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over the Gyanvapi Mosque in Varanasi, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said, "Gyanvapi-like incidents being deliberately stirred up by BJP itself or by their aides behind...veil." "BJP has [a] hate calendar to bring up such issues until elections," the SP chief said. "They [BJP] don't have answers on inflation and unemployment," Akhilesh added.
